  1. Great purchase. I have had this for 2 months and still have not had to replace the cleaning liquid tray yet, although i only shave every 3-4 days. Great razor though, no rashes etc.

  6. This is the best razor I have used. Over the past I have used several different rotary shavers and none have come close the shaving as close as this one does. I would recommend to anyone!!
  7. This is my third Braun electric razor. I hope it continues to perform as well as the past razors did.
  8. I bought this electric razor thru Amazon after researching electric razor options. My husband wanted to switch from a traditional razor to electric, but having tried one many years ago, he was not impressed and decided to keep using the traditional method. He has now reached a point where he was willing to give an electric razor another try. The directions appear to be somewhat overwhelming for a senior citizen, what with the sterilization of the razor head and how to clean it vs. an older or cheaper model that you just plug in and shave with. But he has found that this razor holds its charge and once he has tried it a time or two has found it to be pretty easy to shave with. The razor heads give him a close clean shave and he enjoys the portability of it. He can now take it with when we travel vs making sure he has shave cream and his razor packed. And the cleaning of the razor head has proven to be pretty simple and it thus sanitizes the razor head assuring him that the next time he uses this electric razor it will be clean and sanitized for him.
  9. works very well-does not clean as well as I would like-so need to use the brush weekly.
  10. I use this shaver every day as I go to work. It is better then the last one I had and is very good on battery life.
  11. Best shave by an electric razor.
  12. What more is there to say? I have a pretty tough beard and this is doing a great job. Kind of a pain to pay for the cleaning fluid refills, though.
  13. This is what I always wanted. An electric razor that can be used everyday without skin irritation and a very good shave. Better than other choices. Worth the price.
  14. For those that don't have much facial hair growth, I would still recommend investing in this high end model.<br /><br /> I have been using lower end Braun shavers for many years, finding it difficult to justify the high price since I don't shave so often. But with these low end models if there wasn't enough to shave, it would have a tough time getting a clean shave, often leaving pesky hairs behind that are growing at odd angles. So even though I don't have such long facial hair I would never really be perfectly clean shaven.<br /><br />With the series 7, the center strip between the 2 foils seems to align the odd angled ones so they can be cut cleanly. Definitely a better shave and worth the money even if you don't shave so often.
  15. I don't understand the people who don't like the way this shaver shaves. IT&#34;S FANTASTIC!!!! Close shave, comfortable, the BEST self cleaning system on the market.   17. This is the best electric shaver I've ever had. It gives a good close shave. The only thing I'm not too happy about is the cleaning system, you still have to manually clean the head if you want it clean and not clogged-up. Still t beats Norelco and Remington the two previous brands i owned.

  22. I wanted to wait at least a few months before I actually went ahead and wrote a review on this wonderful shaver. Let me tell you, it is the best electric shaver I have ever used. I started using electric shavers when I was 14 because the conventional blades would irritate my skin really bad and cause me to breakout. I really didn't like the electric shavers because they would pull on my hair or not get all of it. This baby is something else though. It cuts as well if not better than a razor blade. I use it almost everyday and not once have I been disappointed. I really like the clean and renew system too. It keeps the shaver nice and fresh after every use.   27. This is an upgrade from my husbands previous Braun razor which he wore out after many years of use. Since it was a present I had to read a lot of reviews to figure out which one to get. I wasn't crazy about the cleaning system just because it means monthly expenses of the cleaning fluid, but it seems the better razors all have them. One thing I have since noticed is that the razor gives you the choice of doing the cleaning or not. Just setting the razor in the unit doesn't start it up. The indicator light lets you know how dirty the razor is and then you have to push the button to activate it. He's only used it for 2 weeks so I don't know how long the cleaning fluid really does last. This is one of the quietest razors I have ever heard though.
  28. I've always used Braun shavers and this one is the best yet! Gives a really close shave and has nice features. Well worth the price. You won't be disappointed.
  29. The Braun Series 7-760 cc works very well for me. I upgraded from a $39 Norelco rotary razor and can see the difference. The series 7 defintely gives a much, much smoother shave for the same amount of time. With the series-7, I can feel my chin as smooth as they make out to be in the ads. The motor is pretty powerful and you can feel it revving; the flat but longer cutter does a better job than the rotary blades (for me). I do need to watch myself in a shaving mirror up-close to weed out all the areas neat and clean. The personalization adjustments - where you can increase or decrease the intensity of the razor - works fine on the sensitive areas of the neck. So far, I haven't had any red areas after the shave. I do have to stretch my skin as recommended. The cleaning system is a bit of a drain as I look at it. The cleaning cartridge can last upto 60 days, but you will need to replace it - an on-going expense. You can wash the razor under water and the cleaning indicator still says the razor requires the minimum level of cleaning. I plan not to replace the cartridge and stick to water cleaning, though I have to forgo the nice fresh lemon smell when I have it up-close for shaving. The razor can run off the electric cord straight which is a big plus for me as I personally don't like rechargeable batteries - they are not good for the environment. The corded operation means I have less to carry when I travel. While the one sixty bucks price tag is a bit overboard for me for a razor, my shave with the series-7 definitely leaves me satisfied each and every day.
  30. I've used an electric shaver for all of my adult life and was desperately in need of a replacement. I previously had a Remington which admittedly was a low-end model but it had dual foils and cut extremely close to the skin! Didn't need to follow up with a straight razor after shaves. So after reading all of the great reviews for the 7 series decided I needed to upgrade and was willing to pay top dollar for Braun's top-of-the-line electric shaver. After 2-3 shaves I was very disappointed in the product. It did not shave as close as my previous low-end $30 Remington and each time I had to follow-up with a straight razor to get it down to the skin. I will say that it does cut very well with few passes, just not down to the skin which is what I was used to. I even tried stretching my skin making several passes but in the end it did not achieve the results I expected. For the price I think it should match if not surpass a $30 electric razor.
  31. First off, electric shaving experiences can differ person to person. For example someone who has been shaving with a razor for a very long time will take differently to electric shavers than one who has not. Hair texture also matters. That said, I chose the foil over my existing dual-rotor philips because it does not shave a thin layer of skin as well. I tested this by applying after shave post using each shaver type to see how much it stings. The foil types burn far lesser than the rotary kind. So if you want smoother skin post your shave this is the one. However, the Braun Series 7 also has in the middle of the two foil (domes) a splicer. The splicer does take some skin off and you notice that in the neck area where you might have put some more effort shaving. (the hard to reach areas implying more effort shaving were also the areas that stung more with the after shave) The Series 7 offers a good close shave and gets several days of stubble off without any extra effort. The on board trimmer is very useful for a trim and to get the stubborn few strands left. The neck area takes longest otherwise you can a have a quick shave. Where earlier the foil-only shavers were inept, this one with the combination of foil, splicers and a trimmer makes for the best foil shaver around. Negatives - This is a loud shaver. Unlike my rotary shaver this one does not take all the cut hair inside, it does splay around, you need to shave in front of a sink. Unless its daily, where the tiny cut hairs go inside. The Cleaner. I tried to figure out how on what basis it determines when it needs a clean. From my understanding unless it has some very advanced current state sensors the simplest way is to have a counter of how many times the shaver is switched on and off and to set cleaning levels from there. (please correct me, i am only speculating) My experience for the above is after two full shaves and a small trim the cleaning station demanded a maximum clean. I must have switched it on and off several times during this time. The cleaning process is noisy, as the shaver switches on and off (which by itself is loud). It also consumes quite a bit of time. You can clean it manually, which is what you would do most of the time. I don't see great use of the cleaning function aside the fact that I think it disinfects and smells quite ok. Battery lasts a long time, judging from current use. I haven't run it to dry yet as I returned it to station for cleaning a few times so it charges by default. I would suggest get the cheapest of the 7 series models, or if you want the cleaning option get this one here. They all fundamentally work the same except for cleaning functions and some features. It does offer a close shave and is good to the skin.
  32. This is by far the best electric shaver I've ever used, and I've used almost ever brand that's been on the market for the last 40 years. I recommend this shaver without reservation or equivocation. CGDIII, Houston, TX
  33. i think it is perfect
  34. This is a piece of crap. Its hard to set up and the instruction manual leaves a lot to be desired. I should have stayed with Norelco.
  35. I have a Braun Syncro 7526 and am very happy with the shave. The battery was starting to die after years of use, so I decided to buy a new Braun. What a mistake. Worst shave I've ever had. It simply doesn't cut hair. My face was numb from pressing so hard to try to get all the hairs it missed. The sideburn clipper is poorly designed also. It looks like it could break off very easily. Also, blade is razor is curved instead of straight. What a ridiculous design.

  39. This is the best electric razor system I have experienced to date. I have owned all of the brands over the years and research them extensively, tests when possible. Generally, I feel the technology changes enough that I will purchase a newer model every 4-5 years to take advantage of the improvements. Although all brands continue to improve the Braun has consistently been the best for my face and beard.
  40. The shaver works great! The refill liquid is pretty expensive and doesn't last long at all.
  41. I shaved with a blade from the age of 15 to 72, when I had surgery on my \\"shaving hand.\\" I couldn't hold the razor so I bought this electric shaver. It gets an acceptably close shave in 5 or 6 minutes and although it doesn't cut as close as a blade, for quick shaves or just for a change, it is well worth the money. A wonderful part of this shaver is that you simply press a button and it cleans itself. The cleaning liquid lasted about 6 months and might have lasted longer except I decided to err on the safe side and changed it. Well worth the money if you are tired of blade-shaving or you want a quick shave or are at a place when you can't use a blade.
  42. Best razor I ever had! Close shave and excellent cleaning method.
  43. Performed as expected with a fast close shave. Not thrilled with the users manual in that it was a bit awkward and had to be read more than once. I would add a short, bullet point card with the steps to follow (some of us need occasional reminders on what each of these features mean).
  44. This is the third Braun electric shaver I have owned. The features are wonderful. My only criticism about this line of porducts is that, in the past, they wore out within three years. I am hoping I get a longer life out of this version.
  45. I bought a Braun Series 7-760 in November 2010 and when I started to shave with it I was alarmed by the fact that when it cut the whiskers from my face, the cuttings would fall out and litter the sink that I shave over. I thought \\"Well, this isn't right\\" and contacted Braun about it. They assured me that this was not supposed to happen and advised me to send it to be repaired. Well, I called the two service centers in Mass. and neither one of them had ever heard of such a problem so I took advantage of the money-back guarantee and returned the shaver to Braun's returns processing center. I purchased another shaver, same model and the SAME thing happens. I thought maybe I hadn't set the head on the shaver correctly or something. At one point I shaved a 4-day accumulation of growth from my face and the cuttings were falling all over my hand -- felt like bugs were flying into me! Very strange. So I contacted Braun again and they asked that I please send it to a service center, which I did. I then heard back from the service center that because this shaver is not a \\"closed unit,\\" the clippings will indeed fall out. Apparently, the design that allows for the cleaning fluid to flow through the unit also allows the cut hair to fall out during shaving. Not sure why no other review I have read mentions this. I find this to be very aggravating -- you have to clean up all the clippings after every shave! After complaining to Braun once again they emailed me that a \\"small amount\\" of clippings falling out of the shaver during each shave is not unusual. All that being said, the shaver is lighter than it looks and it does provide a very close/comfortable shave. My big complaint is that it's so messy to use. Also, the cleaning fluid can get expensive to use when you figure out the cost for a few years. Also, I put the unit through the cleaning cycle and it was VERY loud -- I thought I had put the shaver in the base incorrectly -- it sounded like someone was cutting metal with an electric saw in my house! For the money this unit costs, you should be able to get a close shave without having to deal with cuttings all over the sink and countertop, but I will repeat that the shave is very close.
  46. Excellent razor, the 2nd one I have owned, this one is even better than the first one that lasted for 7 years and less expensive too. I'mm very happy with it.
  47. The 760cc electric razor is a significant improvement from the 8500 series razor in many ways. It is lighter, quieter shaving, quieter cleaning, and gives a much better shave than the earlier model. If you are not sure whether or not to replace the older razor because it's still working, I recommend it highly.
  48. My husband loves his shaver. It prevents ingrown hairs and works very well.
  49. I have used numerous electric razors, and this is definitely my favorite. I switched from rotarys and could not have been more pleased. While substantially louder (Oral-B electric tooth brush vs. Sonicare) I feel it is much gentler on my face. The cleaning/lubricating base is definitely worth the extra money.

  51. When I was a poor college student, I could only afford the low-end electric razors. I got what I paid for: missed whiskers, shave was not close so I had to shave more often...<br /><br />I hesitated to purchase a Braun shaver because they were so expensive. But when I saw the price come down to $150 (almost 40% off the MSRP), I just had to try it. Braun provides a 60-day money back guarentee (it used to be 90-days). I chose the 760cc over the [[ASIN:B003YJAZZ4 790cc]] because the only difference was the \\"quick clean\\" feature, which, quite frankly, isn't needed unless multiple people are using one razor. And even then, cleaning only takes about 20 minutes.<br /><br />Even though I am used to using an electric razor, there was an adjustment period. The Braun gave me the closest shave I've ever had. If you're not used to this, you will be surprised. You will have to use some sort of aftershave because of this; otherwise, your skin will be irritated all day.<br /><br />The only negative thing about this razor is the proprietary cleaning system. The instructions show you how to clean the razor with just water (for use while travelling). But using the cleaning system at least once a month will make sure that the razor gets the lubrication it needs.<br /><br />Overall, I am satisfied with this purchase and glad the price came down to make it affordable. Not sure if I'd still buy it now that the price is back to over $200.
  52. Best shaving machine ever!!
  53. I've had the Braun 760 for about a month now. I replaced an older Series 5 which I had for several years and was happy with. It was due for a replacement blade and foil so I decided to upgrade to the 760 and the price seemed reasonable on Amazon. I've used Brauns for most of my shaving life and been satisfied. The 760 was a bit more money than the old Series 5 I had and includes the Clean and Renew system which I had never used before - more on that later. The 760 is a truly impressive shaver. It is a noticably faster and closer shave while being more comfortable than my old one. The 760 offers two main advances over my older Series 5 which make a big difference. The main advance is the integrated blade and foil cassette rather than the older separate cutting block and foil arrangement. The integrated cassette provides a very smooth and close shave. All the marketing buzz words like triple action, pulsonic, and optifoil really do add up to an effective shaving system. The foils move separately in multiple dimensions to closely track your face's bumps, nooks, and crannies. The integrated blade allows it to closely track the foils without burning. The shaver is also much quieter than my old one. While I thought the personalization mode was a gimmick,I have been using it on more sensitive spots on my face. Basically, it is a button which slows the shaver down, but it is effective. The other major advance is the abiltiy to rinse the shaver in water. This is important for travel. I never have to use the brush now. A rinse is quick and very effective. I was fully prepared to dislike the Clean and Renew system as a gimmick to sell the cleaning cartridges. However, I have been very impressed with it. Simple to use and it is very thorough with the shaver coming out looking like new. No goo or films on it. I don't use it every day and am on my second month of the first cartridge using it every few days. It is a bit noisy when it goes through the cycles, but overall seems a very good system. Looks like I'll get two months out of a cartridge, which makes it more cost effective. I was buying cleaning sprays and fluids for my old shaver and that was a lot more work. I wouldn't be surprised if I get roped into using it more often because it is so convenient. It's a bit bulky, but I keep it in a vanity drawer when I'm not using it. Rinsing is quick and very effective, but the clean and renew saves those few seconds in the morning for me and provides lubrication for the cutting system. Overall, I'm very pleased with the Braun 760. Looks to be a good value to get get the clean and renew system compared to the 720, which doesn't have the clean and renew, and the 790 which looks to be almost identical for a lot more money in a fancier color - no one watches me shave. the Braun 760 wasn't cheap, but hey, it's my face and I've been very happy with it. If you are an electric shaver guy, I can't imagine going wrong with this shaver. Also, my son has the Series 3 without the clean and renew, and it doesn't have the swivel head of the 7 series, but shares the same integrated cassette block technology and rinsability - great value for a younger shaver.
  54. I've been shaving for 20 years and I've tried everything from cheap electrics (terrible idea, but I was just a kid) to mach 3 turbo razors (best non-electric for me btw) to expensive Norelco and Remington models. After shaving with the Braun Series 7 (only the series 7, the lesser series are not in the same league), I will never shave with anything else if I have my choice.<br /><br />The difference is 2 important things to me. First, I'm a pretty hairy guy, so I need a close shave in the morning or else I'll have to shave again at lunch time. This shaver takes care of that problem where other brands I've tried just don't get close enough. Second, I have sensitive skin, especially when shaving the neck. Anybody who has shaved before a workout knows the burn when the sweat hits your fresh shave. For any guy who is sick of having little red spots all over your face and neck from the irritation (attention Mach 3 users), this is the shaver for you. It's so smooth that I don't even use after shave and I haven't for years.<br /><br />The shaver cleaning function is just a bonus in my opinion. There's something great about feeling like your shaver is clean like it was brand new every morning.
  55. Before you buy a gadget this complicated you should consider if it will really work and whether the manufacturer will stand behind it when it fails. This works fine as an ordinary razor. But the motivation for paying so much money is the automatic cleaning system. Well, I have news for you--that part is a piece of poorly conceived, poorly engineered, and poorly executed junk. The problem is not merely that the autocleaning function does not properly clear itself of cut hair, but also that the system itself will simply die on you unexpectedly. In my case after about 4 months of use. Of course the razor still works if you plug it in directly to charge the battery, but the loss of the maintenance system is a severe hit to utility. Worse, when you go to get the thing fixed you find there is no practical or convenient place to go. Braun does not maintain company supported service centers in the US and rather depends on a disorganized set of randomly and poorly accessible private vendors. For example, no one services Braun shaver products in DC or MD. The only servicers are private companies in Wilmington and Virginia Beach. So the only way to get this fixed is to deal with someone 3 hours away who isn't even a Braun specialist. The company itself provides NO SUPPORT to its customers. This is a BIG FAIL.
  56. I have used the Braun 3 series shaver for almost 2 years. The trimmer broke during travel and the cleaning system was no longer usable afterwards. I loved the 3 series. However, I read the reviews of the 7 series. The 7 series does cost more... BUT IT IS WORTH IT! I shave all of my head with an electric razor. Face, neck, head...all of it. This razor glides through my hair like the 3 series never did. And my girlfriend swears I am using a blade in regard to how smooth my face is. If you can afford this razor... You will not be disappointed. It is the best purchase I have made in some time.

And here's the kicker, IT CAN'T BE RETURNED! When I get done shaving with the Braun 760cc I look like I already have my 5 o'clock shadow coming in. It doesn't matter how hard I try I cannot get a close shave with this razor. Very disappointing. What I plan to do now is use it as a $200 paperweight (the case it comes with is very attractive) and buy a replacement NiCd battery for my Norelco that I will have to solder in myself. Could have saved myself 190 dollars if someone had posted a review like this before I bought this. Its better than shaving with a sharpened stone. Thats the only positive thing I can think to say.
  59. I've only ever had Remington razors in the past and tried this Braun based on a recommendation. I've had the shaver for nearly a month now and absolutely love it.   65. I have had the benefit of owning the Braun 3-390cc, 3-370, and now the 7-760cc...all in the last 4 months. Before this I owned the 8585 Activator, and before that the 6520 Flex Integral. Before that I forget, but I have been shaving with Braun shavers for about 20 years. They rarely go bad...I just get enticed to buy the latest technology.<br /><br />I bought the 3-390cc about 4 months ago. Before I even had a chance to give it a proper review, TSA lost my shaving kit while inspecting my baggage, and so my shaver was gone. This shaver lacked power. If I skipped a day of shaving, it really bogged down on two days worth of stubble. I felt like I had to have my face 5 times to get everything. And the cleaning system was very rudimentary. If you dropped the shaver into the cleaning system and pressed the button to latch it in there, it cleaned the shaver automatically, whether it was dirty or not. Even if you just cleaned it a few hours ago. No \\"sensing technology\\". I don't believe the 3-390cc cleaner had a heated dry either because it would still be wet with the alcohol solution 6-8 hours later. Also, after only 3 months there was a build up of scum in the cleaner where the shaver sits. I opened up the shaver's blade cartridge a couple of times and it still had a few whiskers in there. I probably would have rated it 3 stars.<br /><br />Since TSA lost my 3-390 shaver, but I still had the cleaning system at home, I bought a standalone 3-370 with no cleaning system. I found out quickly it didn't work with the cleaning system from the 3-390cc. I inquired with Braun (P&G) and they said it should, but it didn't, so I sent it back. The 3-370 shaves exactly like the 3-390. I think it has one less LED indicator, and that's it.<br /><br />I decided this was a sign that I needed to look higher up in the Braun shaving lineup. I'm amazed I even found this shaver because Amazon's search engine is so quirky and doesn't provide this shaver as an option in the Braun Store. This is by far the best looking Braun shaver I have ever seen, and may be the best overall shaver I have ever owned.<br /><br />The 7-760 is MUCH more powerful than the 3 Series shavers. I shaved two days worth of stubble today like a hot knife goes through butter. This shaver has easily cut my shaving time in half. It does a much better job with neck hair that lays flat and is hard to get. The Pulsonic technology vibrates and almost gives you a face massage while you're shaving. Braun recommends that you set the Pulsonic strength level to high for the best shave,and they are right. I've noticed that this shaver allows me to get closer to my chin beard without pulling any of the whiskers out (ouch!). It has a much more precise feel to it. The pop out trimmer is a little unusual, but I have gotten used to it already and it does a good job.<br /><br />The 7-760 cleaning system is much better too. It senses the level of cleaning needed and reports what level cleaning it intends to do via an indicator light, but waits until you actually push a \\"GO\\" button. I really like this new feature because my 8585 had this sensing technology, but proceeded with cleaning as soon as you dropped the shaver into the cleaning system. The 7-760 cleaner is built much more like the cleaner from the 8585 Activator, and I think it does a better job than the new style of cleaner that comes with the 3 Series. No scum is accumulating in the cleaner, and not a single whisker is left in the shaver after it is done with a light cleaning. If you clean the shaver ever day it appears that it never has to do a deep cleaning, because I haven't seen one yet.<br /><br />Braun is skimping on the case and brush these days. The case is the same for the 3-370, 3-390 & 7-760. The 7-760 gets a little bit bigger brush, but that's it. No room in the case to take along the power cord. The cleaning systems for each model use the exact same Clean & Renew refills, which is nice.<br /><br />All in all, I recommend this shaver. If you've tried a cheaper Braun and aren't happy, take them up on their 60-day money back offer and get this one. I think you'll see a big difference. I wish the 7-760cc didn't cost me $220, but it appears I'm an early adopter, so maybe the price will come down.cheaper Braun and aren't happy, take them up on their 60-day money back offer and get this one. I think you'll see a big difference. I wish the 7-760cc didn't cost me $220, but it appears I'm an early adopter, so maybe the price will come down.

  79. I used rasors all my life and I decided to try an electric one. First I bought the Braun 5 series, at the beginning I did not get a close shave like the razor especially under the neck, but I noticed that every time I use the electric shaver I have better and better shave. After about one month I had a better cleaner shave, my skin got used to it. So I decided to get the 7 series. I baught this one 7600cc, and it is far better than the 5 series, it has more power, the design and the pulsonic effect is great, and it gives me a better shave espically under the neck areas. The 5 series usually leaves behind few hairs under the neck, but the 7 series did a great job, I am keeping this one. I was comparing between 7600cc and the 7900cc models, and decided to stick with this one, since it is little bit cheaper and it has the same technology and the same electric shaver, the only difference is the cleaning time, which is not really important, it already takes 20 min for the cleaning, so it is not a big deal. Update: (12-27-2011) Just a quick update, I also bought the Panasonic 4 blades, it works fine and faster than the Braun ones, it usually takes 10-15 min to shavewith the Braun shaver,, but with the panasonic it took me about 5-8 min. And it is smooth on my skin. I realize that every skin is different so do yourself a favor and try the Panasonic one as well, you will not regret it.
  80. Good for shaving and easy to clean it.<br />Led lamp for charging status is great.<br />The design is good for me
  81. I am on my third Braun over several years. Overall I find it the best shave and I really like the cleaning mechanism. One of three I bought had an LCD display problem but Amazon replaced the unit immediately. The blades last about a year as they would on any electric razor. I would buy this unit again when the time comes.

  91. I bought two Braun shavers back in 2000-2001 - the 7570 and 7526 models, both with cleaners. One for my son (16 yrs old at the time) and one for myself. My son has since moved out and uses a blade, so I still have both of these shavers and they still work after about 15 years. The amazing thing is the batteries still hold enough power in both of them to last for a week worth of shaves, especially after one sat dormant without charging for a few years and it still works great.. I do change the foils and blades every year or so. I just saw one of the Cooltec models in the store today on sale and bought it, so I guess I'll be retiring these two shavers and use them for backups or traveling. I highly recommend Braun shavers, they are not perfect in every aspect for everybody, but you'll get your money's worth in longevity in my experience.

  100. This is a great razor. It does an excellent job of getting a very close shave. I also like the self-cleaning feature, although it's a bit noisy.
  101. About ten years ago I put away my Norelco 885 RX tri-headed rotary and started shaving with a safety razor, shaving soap, mug, and shaving brush. The shave was much closer and I didn’t irritate my neck, which happened often with the Norelco. Recently, I had to go on a weeklong trip and didn’t want to lug my mug, razor, and brush, so I took my old Norelco. It didn’t shave as close as the safety razor, it no longer held a charge (I had to shave with it plugged in) and it irritated my neck, but it was much faster. When I got home I looked at Consumers Reports and Amazon reviews and decided to buy a Braun series 7, the intermediate model 760 cc (whatever that means). When I opened the package a slip of paper warned me that it would take about two weeks of daily shaves before the Braun would get as close as a rotary or a safety razor. I decided to do my own experiment. I would continue shaving the left side of my face, chin and neck with the Norelco and use my new Braun on the right side. For the first week the Norelco shaved closer, but, as expected, it irritated my neck. By the end of the second week the Braun had caught up and to my fingertips gave as close a shave as the Norelco, maybe even a little closer. I decided to bring in independent judges, my two grandsons, ages 5 and 7. I rubbed their tender cheeks, one side with my Norelco shave, the other with the Braun shave. As they say in scientific jargon, they were double blinded (well sort of): neither knew which brand of razor I had applied to which side of my face and neither knew what his brother had decided. The results were equivocal. One said there was no difference and the other said the Braun side was closer. They refused to repeat the experiment.<br /> I decided to keep the Braun, mostly because it was too much trouble to return to Braun; the instructions said not to return it to Amazon. The cleaning system adds on a few bucks a month for the cartridges and is too big and heavy to carry in anovernight case; the head has a finite lifetime according to Braun, which means replacing the cassette adds another expense. (I’ve been using the same heads on the Norelco for years with no noticeable decrease in the quality of my shave.) When I travel, I’ll take just the razor and the tiny brush to clean it manually. If I’m going to be away for more than a couple of weeks I’ll take the cord to keep it charged. True, the Braun doesn’t irritate my skin, but I’ll tell you one thing: a safety razor with a good lather and hot water beats any electric any day. It does take longer and occasionally cuts. That’s the tradeoff.
  102. Just returned another company's shaver after I questioned its quality control (plus I wasn't thrilled about the shave or the shaver built). Just purchased the 790cc4 and have used it for a few days - initial impressions: the shave is pretty good - no irritation (and I expect it to get better after my face conforms to the shaver). The shaver is solidly built and the cleaner works great. I am hard to satisy - but I do recommend this shaver (not the old 790 but the new one).
  103. I bought this Braun for my husband for Christmas. I basically needed a self service razor that required little or no maintenance as my husband is the epitome of not wanting to do any maintenance. He has only used it a couple times and says that it almost does as good of a job as his old Gillette Fusion. This little system checks the quality and cleanliness of the blade each time the razor is placed back into the cleaning/charging station. It waits for 'permission' before it does a cleaning cycle which is nice due to the fact that it saves on cleaning fluid and excessing cleaning on the blades. This will also be nice when he goes on business trips as it states that it has a 50h usage time in between complete charges. So far, it has been a nice investment.
  104. The very best razor I have ever had, I enjoy using it, it is fun does a great close shave which is important for old retired Military guy. I also use the self cleaner after every use. expensive but you get what you pay for.
  105. I have used an electric shaver for many years. I have tried a number of brands, but was disappointed by each one. Even the best shaver I used in the past would still miss some flat lying hairs on my neck and the blades and screen wore out quickly. After a month or two, shaving was abrasive to my skin and it hurt to shave. Having never tried a Braun shaver before, I was a little reluctant to spend the extra money to purchase one, but I finally decided to give this shaver a try, and am glad I did.<br /><br />But after years of frustration with previous electric shavers, I decided to go ahead and spend the money and buy the Braun Series 7 760cc Shaver System. Man, am I impressed. I got a close, clean shave every time, not just the very first time. This shaver did not miss a single hair on my neck (a problem with all shavers I used in the past). It delivered a shave equally as close as a razor without the nicks and cuts a razor can leave. The pivoting head makes it easy to shave areas difficult to reach and reduces the time spent shaving. The razor did not burn my face and I could wear cologne right after shaving without my face burning.<br /><br />What convinced me to buy the shaver is one of its best features, the clean and renew system. After each shave, the clean and renew system thoroughly cleans and renews the blades for the next shave. When finished cleaning the blades, a heating element dries the blades. In minutes it is ready for the next shave. I was skeptical of how well it could automatically clean itself, but it works great.<br /><br />You do not have to use the clean and renew system after each shave, you can skip a shave or use water to clean the blades, but I would recommend you use the clean and renew feature after every shave. No more cleaning clipped hair from the blades and running a brush through the blades to clean it. The clean and renew system does all the cleaning for you, and even dries the blades once the solution is finished cleaning.<br /><br />One other nice feature is the shaver can be used with the cord while shaving if the battery is depleted. This is a great feature for traveling, when you might not want to take the clean and renew system with you. My previous shavers would not work with the cord if the battery was dead.<br /><br />The blades are supposed to last 18 months with this shaver. If so, the shaver will eventually pay for itself. The blades on my previous shaver had to be replaced every 4 months.<br /><br />While the initial cost of the shaver may appear prohibitive, it is well worth the money. The closer shave, reduced shaving time, and fewer blade replacements certainly justify the initial expense.<br /><br />I cannot recommend this shaver highly enough, especially for men already using an electric shaver and are disappointed in the results.feature is the shaver can be used with the cord while shaving if the battery is depleted. This is a great feature for traveling, when you might not want to take the clean and renew system with you. My previous shavers would not work with the cord if the battery was dead. The blades are supposed to last 18 months with this shaver. If so, the shaver will eventually pay for itself. The blades on my previous shaver had to be replaced every 4 months. While the initial cost of the shaver may appear prohibitive, it is well worth the money. The closer shave, reduced shaving time, and fewer blade replacements certainly justify the initial expense. I cannot recommend this shaver highly enough, especially for men already using an electric shaver and are disappointed in the results.
  106. Just bought this product in the store (Target) for $245.00!!! I dont like buying things online due to the return hassle. Anyways, I hate to say it but this is not a good shaver. I had high hopes for it but it does not give a close shave. It shaves close on the face but misses a TON of hairs on the neck. No matter what I did (shave against the grain, pull skin tight, shave in all directions, etc) it would not clip alot of the neck hairs. Im just a regular guy with nothing unusual about my facial hair. It looks cool and the cleaning station is all fancy and crap but at the end of the day It does not give a close shave. I do not mind spending alot of money to get a close shave but this just didnt do it. Im shocked that for this price it wasnt better. Im disappointed and Im returning this.
  107. This is a remarkable machine much better than my original Braun, which must be at least 25 years old.The cleaning and recharging tower work perfectly.
  108. If you have to clean up your electric shaver's work with a razor every time, you're not saving yourself time, or convenience, or skin irritation, or money. This shaver sports a hefty price tag, but the only real bell and whistle you're getting is the opportunity to buy a $20 refill cartridge every two months... designed to evaporate in 60 days regardless of whether you use it to clean the shaver.<br />That's $10/mo. Put into perspective, that's a Spotify premium account you're spending for a shave that is every bit as mediocre as every other electric shaver in this design, especially on the neck. I'll be returning mine quite soon.<br /><br />Also, this product was listed as Amazon Prime, but took a week to arrive, while all other items in the order came in 2 days.
  109. I've used this shaver for 18 months now. I bought this model to replace the simple Norelco rotary shaver my father gave me when I first started shaving in my early teens. I was attracted to this product originally because of the self-cleaning feature. Overall I like the product, but it isn't perfect. I get a good shave with it, and the cleaning system is a great convenience.<br /><br />It gives a good, close shave on the face, under the chin, and along the jawline. It is possible, but difficult, to get a close shave on the neck, which seems to be a limitation of many electric shavers. It's also difficult to get a good shave on the upper lip, which surprises me a little bit because I'd think that wouldn't be a difficult surface to shave. I have fairly sensitive skin, but none of the three shave intensity settings irritate my skin more than the others -- I usually use the higher setting when I'm in more of a rush, and I never use the lowest setting.<br /><br />The locking slide on the shaver head broke off within the first two months of using the shaver, and even when it wasn't broken, it didn't lock the shaver head with enough force to actually keep it from moving. This problem didn't affect the number of stars I gave the shaver because I don't use the lock very much, and I don't personally regard it as a particularly important feature of a shaver.<br /><br />The automatic cleaning feature of the shaver, in my opinion the most important and attractive feature, replaces the need to daily empty and clean the shaver, as you do with other electrics. It does not entirely eliminate the need to remove the shaver cassette and clean the cassette and head internals, however. The cleaning cartridges last for about 30 uses as advertised, and I usually remove the shaver cassette when replacing the cleaning cartridge and clean the internals under running water as with a conventional electric shaver using an old electric toothbrush dedicated for cleaning purposes. The automatic cleaning solution has pleasant, clean scent, and the solution seems to keep the shaver head lubricated. It never feels like I'm shaving with dry, dull metal.<br /><br />I noticed in the last couple of days that the finish on the shaver body near the head has started to flake off. The finish isn't covered by the manufacturer's warranty, and I don't believe at this point that it will affect the performance of the shaver, but I also don't like to appear as though I own poorly made products.

  112. I have used Panasonic razors for years, having gone through 3 of them as the batteries would eventually die as all batteries will. This time I decided to try the Braun. I am very glad that I did so. The Panasonic shaves close, this one is even closer, and does a much better job on the spots on my face that for some reason resist getting close. The Braun is generates far fewer decibels of buzzing, another big plus. Additionally, I could never get a full week's worth of shaves from a single charge on the Panasonic. In the month that I have owned the Braun, it has easily lasted for a week's seven shaves. It is much simpler to charge only once weekly. So on all these counts, the Braun wins. It also feels more solid and better engineered.

You will get much less irritation and a closer shave. I use Lab Series Electric Shave Solution preshave. You can buy it on Amazon, but I can actually get it cheaper at my local Macy's. Works much better than William's 'Electric Shave. I've also use Remington Face Saver. It works slightly better than the Lab Series for me, but it is a dry product with a lot of talc in it.   127. I had been using an older 3 series Braun for far too long. I wasn't very good about shaving daily and the performance of the old razor was to blame. This new series 7 razor provides a much more comfortable and quicker shave, so this time around my face has become accustomed to the razor faster which means I shave more often. I'm not a fan of the button; I keep wanting to slide a plate to start the razor like my old model. I really like the cleaning function, but being tied to an additional accessory beyond just changing the blades is kind of a pain. So far I like the result of running the cleaning cycle, so I am hoping it really does prolong the life of the blades, and it makes the razor smell nice. The blue light on the charging dock is very bright, so you either have to unplug it at night, or direct the light away from where you are sleeping. The charging/cleaning dock takes up a fair amount of counter space, but you don't have to use it all the time. The razor came with a travel bag and small brush, and the charging cord can be plugged straight into the razor instead of the cleaning dock. I haven't had a chance to test the battery life as mine resides in the dock most of the time. It gives me a nice shave, and it was a good deal. Recommended.

  133. Background<br />I have only used a Gillette Fusion Razor previous to owning my Braun 760. I have to be dressed professionally for work everyday so i am shaving quite often. I could get away with shaving 2 or 3 times a week, about every other day. My hair does not grow back that fast, and only gets mildly thick after about 4 days of not shaving.<br /><br />Battery Life<br />Absolutely great! I only charge this thing every other week after moderate use. The battery lasts and lasts. great point about charging is that you can plug the cord directly into the charger, it doesn't have to charge on the base.<br /><br />Shave<br />I think it does a great job. Now let me also say that it took about 3 weeks of shaving for my hair/face to adapt to the shaver. This might sound stupid, but it's true. The first few weeks, shaving took 10-15 minutes. It was very repetitive and a bit frustrating. But the more I used the shaver, not only did i become more comfortable with it, but I am able to get a closer shave now. It's like the hair grows in, in such a way to make the shaver more efficient.<br />My advice is to follow the directions on how to hold the shaver etc (again it seems like a no brainer but it helps to avoid frustration) and to give this shaver at least 30 days of trial. Braun gives you a 60 day guarantee, so you can always back out.<br />I have to shave about every other day in order to keep everything smooth.<br /><br />Cleaning<br />So, the cartridge comes off easily and the included brush is adequate for cleaning the shaver and cartridge. You can also run it under warm/hot water to clean it up. The stand itself does a good job cleaning as well. But this is a bit of a rub for me. After 1 use, I will clean it all up with my brush, etc and the base still says it's at level 1 dirty (3 levels total). Now I wont use the auto clean function except for every other week. Otherwise I would be using it after each shave, and i don't want to waste the cleaning solution like that. Now granted, it will do a different level of cleaning depending on how dirty the shaver is, but I wouldn't even worry about it.<br />As long as you manually clean after each shave, you can afford to use the auto cleaner weekly or bi-weekly.<br /><br />Conclusion<br />Overall, I am very satisfied with the shaver. Sure there are little bits I'm not a big fan of, but this shaver met or exceeded my expectations, even at the price that I paid for it. It was money well spent for me. It makes my life easier now, and I have a more consistent shave in less time than I did while using my manual razor. I can shave in 5 minutes in the mornings now instead of the night before with my razor.<br />Based on my level of satisfaction I think this product deserves 5 Stars.depending on how dirty the shaver is, but I wouldn't even worry about it. As long as you manually clean after each shave, you can afford to use the auto cleaner weekly or bi-weekly. Conclusion Overall, I am very satisfied with the shaver. Sure there are little bits I'm not a big fan of, but this shaver met or exceeded my expectations, even at the price that I paid for it. It was money well spent for me. It makes my life easier now, and I have a more consistent shave in less time than I did while using my manual razor. I can shave in 5 minutes in the mornings now instead of the night before with my razor. Based on my level of satisfaction I think this product deserves 5 Stars.

  136. I am using my wife's account to write this review.<br /><br />I bought the Braun 760cc electric shaver, type 5693, two months ago, when my old and reliable Braun 6520 died after 15 years of constant use. The difference is so huge between the two shavers that it shows how much evolution the Braun shavers went through.<br /><br />First, the smoothness of the head/foil is incredible. I feel now like if I had shaved with a sandpaper before.<br />Second, the electric motor is a lot more noiseless than my 6520. That makes a difference in the morning.<br />Third, vibration in the handle is almost nonexistent. With the 6520, if I had to shave a two days beard, I could end up with a numbed thumb. That is not the case anymore.<br />Finally, the battery seems to hold its charge much longer, although I don't really remember for how long I could shave with my 6520 when I first bought it.<br /><br />In short, I am quite pleased with this new shaver and would recommend it to a friend without hesitation. The 760cc is the third electric and Braun shaver I own.<br /><br />Update 2012-02-10<br />There is a \\"flaw\\" in the design of the Braun cleaning system. The long hair trimmer socket will get dirty over time, if you don't clean your shaver after each shaving, as the cleaning station does not reach it. One way to clean it, then, is to use the brush, but this tool doesn't do a great job, since it doesn't reach all the deeper spots in the socket. Best way to do it is to blow some air.<br /><br />Update 2012-11-05<br />I lower the rating from 5 to 3 stars, because after only one year of 7 days a week use, the Braun 760cc started to make a strange noise. Sporadically at first, then every day. Still under warranty, I shipped it back last week and it turned out they had to replace the head and the electric motor (they had to, because both parts are tied together). Wow! Just after one year of normal use (I never dropped the shaver). This is no good news for the future, especially if one partfails, you need to replace both and pay for both. Service was excellent, though.<br /><br />Update 2013-10-24<br />I lower the rating from 3 to 2 stars, because the base of the cleaning system now leaks like a tap and spills all the liquid over the counter. It is unusable and I am left with the hand cleaning option only. The quality of the whole system is definitively low and I should look at another brand when time comes to change my electric shaver. Very disappointed by this Braun shaver. I keep the rating at 2 because it does shave well, but the quality has really gone downhill.
  137. I've been using the Braun Series 7 769cc for about a month now. Comparing it to an old Philips i had been using, this is an amazing shaver. In summary, i'll list the pros and cons i've experienced with this shaver: Pros: 1. Came packaged very neatly and in a professional manner 2. Charger can take a very good range of voltage so that it can be used in most countries 3. Charging time only takes about 1 hour or less 4. Shaving after cleaning (ex. a few hours or the day after) gives you a very smooth feeling and shaving does in fact feel much better 5. Very easy to use, yet it includes options regarding the power of the shave you want 6. Does not seem to \\"shave less\\" after running for a few minutes Cons: 1. Shaving time (at least for me) is surely not 5 mins every time if I shave everyday. For me, shaving time is between 10-25 mins depending on whether I shave everyday or three times a week 2. Cleaning fluids are costly, and somehow I can't buy them from Amazon since they don't deliver to Malta 3. Even if you wash the shaver under water and soap, the cleaning set still shows you that you need to clean the shaver. This means that, either how much cleaning is needed is calculated on the time the shaver is run, or washing the shaver head under water and soap does not clean the shaver by 100% 4. Some cuts and skin burning feeling after shaving, however this is due acne breakouts, although it takes a whole week to heal again so it's rather awkward going out and looking partially red, partially white. Another point I wish to make is that, for me, the areas on the left and right side under the chin are the most difficult to shave. In fact, sometimes I cut my skin shaving due to the amount of many times I try to shave that part. I don't know if this is common for all electric shavers, but my old philips did not cut my skin, although it shave as deeply as this braun one. Overall I've given it a five star rank, as it is a very good shaver and gives you thebaby-face feeling after shaving, which lasts a couple of hours. Btw, for those who have recently bought it or are considering buying it and wish to save up on cleaning cartridges, try to clean the shaver under water everyday and then clean it using the shaving set once a week. This way, a cartridge can be used for two months.
  138. For 5 years I was using Norelco 8894xl, the top of the line of shavers at that time. Very reliable, it never gave me any problem during 5 years but this Braun 7 Series is very impressive. The shaving is much closer and no irritation at all. I just wish it will last me as long the Norelco. 50 minutes of shaving is less than half than the 120 minutes I was getting with norelco but its still long enough for a week of shaving. I have sensitive skin. Norelco used to give me bumps at the neck area and also irritated the skin if I tried to get a closer shave. I couldn't shave every day because I wanted the skin to heal before the next shave. Braun is much much better, much closer shave. Neck area is always need a little more time but the shaver doesn't irritate the skin even if you press hard against the skin. I wanted to buy both, this and the new norelco shaver, try them both and keep the best but I'm so happy with this one that I don't want to go back to rotating shavers any more. I highly recommend to try this shave. Braun give you also 60 days customer satisfaction to try it.
  139. I had seen many positive reviews for this product and I decided to give it a shot. As a member of the military, I have to shave every day, and, while I love having a perfectly smooth face after a shave with my Gillette Fusion, I basically need to switch the blade at least once a week in order to save my face from irritation. I have used electric shavers before (mostly norelco), and I could never stick with them because, no matter how hard I tried, I could never get my face to feel smooth after shaving with an electric. After purchasing this product, I must say that I'm impressed. It is not as close as I can get with a blade, but it is very close to it. The trimmer does an excellent job on my side burns, and the shaver has caused no irritation and seems to be getting better every time I use it. This is the first time that I've actually believed that the 'adjustment period' for electric razors is real. I've been using it for a week, and every day the shave has felt a bit closer. The only reason that I wouldn't rate it 5 stars is because it is very loud. I'll have to get creative when I'm deployed in order not to wake my bunk-mates up when I shave... or when I'm cleaning my blade. I'm also realizing that the cost savings won't be that great over purchasing disposable blades since I'll have to replace the cleaning solution monthly, but overall, this product is outstanding.
  140. I purchased this shaver in hopes of reducing the amount of stress was causing to my face, and am I glad I did. I was having problems with regular gillette razors and was causing damage to my skin as I have some acne. I tried using the Norelco 3 disc shaver but found that it wasn't shaving very well. I decided to try the Braun Series 7 style shaver and got great results from the first time I used it. Not only is it easy to clean, but it holds its charge for about 1 week (used every day of the week) and also stays sharp. I have had this product for about 3 months and have yet to have a single issue. From rugged skin to sensitive skin, this is a quality product that won't give you any problems. The tilt settings of the hear are fantastic as it allows the head to swivel and take the shape of my jaws geometry easily without missing a hair. If you are looking for a product to get the job done on a daily basis, then go for this product as it will not let you down!
  141. I tried this shaver for a month, and I really wanted to like it. Technically, it's better than the older versions Braun made, but I really didn't think I got as good a shave with this one. Ultimately, I sent it back to Braun for a refund. You should note that Amazon will not accept returns of this product. You have to send it directly to Braun and wait weeks to get your money back, which comes to you on a Visa Debit Card. You also are responsible for paying the shipping cost of sending it back. That is not the most customer friendly approach for either Braun or Amazon. I ended up buying a replacement foil and cutter block set for my old Braun, and I'm back in business.
  142. I bought the Braun 760cc shaver because I was tired of all the razor burn and irritation that came with using a blade every day. I ended up getting this one and the Norelco 3D to see which one was the best. I tried both shavers for a week and the Braun came out the victor. The Braun gave a more consistent shave. Some days the Norelco would miss small patches of hair here or there. The Braun got my entire face consistently smooth. The Braun got the edge in closeness as well. After the shave, I felt like I had just shaved with blade. Nice and smooth even in the trouble areas on the neck. The Norelco also gave a good shave. It was just about as close, but the Braun just felt slightly closer. When it came to irritation the Braun really had advantage here. I felt no irritation at all after my shave. With the Norelco, I consistently had some slight irritation on the neck. I could have lived with it just fine if the shave would have been closer. The only place that I give the Norelco the edge is in shave time. It only takes about 3-4 min to shave with the Norelco. It takes about 5-6 to shave with the Braun. Overall both shavers were great. I wanted something to use every day, and I found it in the Braun. It is much nicer to wake up and shave with the electric instead of dragging the blade across my face. After the shave, all I have to do is stick it in the cleaning stand hit the button and go about my day.

  149. I have never used electric shavers until now because I never felt I got a close shave. This shaver does a fairly good job of getting what I consider a close shave, better than any other electric I have had. The cleaning system is excellent, and it holds a charge for over a week on trips.
  150. I got this to replace a several year-old Braun 7 series and I mostly prefer the new design. I think the 7-760 does a better job of shaving and saves me time each morning. This design just has the shaver drop into place and is much less likely to give problems. The cleaning cycles are noisy, but seem to work well. I do find it difficult to correctly place the shaver in the cleaner/charger without having to jiggle it into place, but it isn't a big deal. I'd still like to see an electric shaver that made a revolutionary improvement in shaving time each morning, but for now this is a very good incremental improvement over older designs. A solid 4 star performer.

  168. Great shaver. Even though this is my first shaver, switching from a manual razor, I had no irritation whatsoever (even though the manual said that it would take 1-3 weeks for you to adjust).<br /><br />I find that in 2-3 slow passes, keeping the shaver in constant contact with my skin, it can completely and smoothly shave my face.<br /><br />The only thing I don't like is the cost of the cleaning solution, and the fact that shaver seems to decide whether it's dirty or not based on how many times you use it (as opposed to some measurement of how dirty the device actually is). It seems to time how long you use it, and once you use it for a certain amount of time it decides that the device is dirty (and requires cleaning with the expensive cleaning solution) even if you clean it yourself. I understand that it needs to be lubricated and all, and I can always not push the button to clean it (which is what I do), but I think it's somewhat deceptive to have it tell you that the device is dirty and make you use up cleaning solution even when it isn't dirty.

  170. So, i bought one of these, dreaming of fast, easy, close shaves, adding minutes to to the harried mornings of a single dad. Didn't pan out. Yes, I shave before my shower (as recommended), but any hopes of time savings are dashed as I have to go over and over the same patch of face 6 or 8 times (god forbid I leave it to get long, 5 or 6 days, as I'll have to double the number of tries), sometimes in a scrubbing motion, with the grain, against the grain, sideways to the grain, to make sure that I've gotten all of the hairs. Then, sometimes I miss hairs and I'm worrying at them all day, like a loose tooth. Granted, the parts that are shaved are done closely. With a blade, 1 or 2 swipes and the hairs are cut and I know if I've missed any hairs because the lack of shaving cream in a particular area is a good indicator of razed ground. So, for me, shaving with this (and I'v been doing it for about 5 months) is slow and returns uneven results - I'm going back to razors.

  179. It took me 3 days to be convinced, but I'm throwing out my shaving cream. My shave this morning is as close as my Fusion Power and with the added benefit of not hacking up my neck. Don't buy the 790CC. For the extra money you are buying a different paint job, an LCD vs LED battery display, and a 25 second clean feature. The only feature that might be useful is the 25 second clean, because a full clean takes 45 minutes, but save yourself the money and hit the clean button when you leave for work in the morning. I have sensitive skin and constantly end up with cuts and razor burn on my neck. As a result since I work from home, I've taken to only shaving when I absolutely have to(nights out with the wife, business trips). So most of the time I look like a hobo/hermit. So let me walk you through the first 3 days I've had with the 760CC. Day 1 Bought the razor. Shaved 4 days growth, I went quick. Ended up with patch results. Where it was shaved it was fairly close but not as close as my razor. Very similar results to a quick shave with a razor after 4 days growth. Day 2 Started on my face, focused on getting my face and jawline clean. Ended on my neck and didn't do a very good job. Close shave on my face, but trouble spots on my neck remained. I have had to skip those spots in the past because using a razor can be very uncomfortable. After this shave, my face started to feel a little itchy, so I started using my moisturizing aftershave again. Day 3 Started on the trouble spots on my neck. Moved the razor head more slowly than what I have been in the previous days. Ended on my face, hitting the chin and jawline with the locked head. I think today's shave may actually be closer than my Fusion, and very little irritation. I would strongly recommend this razor to anyone that is thinking about switching to electric. I have tried foil, and rotary's in the past with poor results, I was either too impatient when I was younger, or the razor's were inferior.The auto cleaner on the razor is great for home use. It takes a while, it's not quiet, but it cleans the razor and the razor always comes out dry, something that wasn't true with other electrics I've tried. For travel, you're going to leave the auto cleaner behind, it doesn't transport well because the liquid in it can easily spill. This isn't a big problem, because you can clean the razor under the tap, and then just let the head dry out during the day. Alternatively you can brush it out with the provided brush, but why would you? The battery is said to give 50 minutes of use, which should equal about 10 days of shaving. I haven't spent more than 5 minutes shaving in any of my shaves so far. I don't plan to bring the cord with me on most trips because I mostly travel for 2-3 days. In summary, this is an excellent shaver, and for my face it's comparable to a good wet shave system. Unfortunately the price is high which means it will take a while to recoup your investment against your wet shaving system, even with the ridiculous price of blades. For me it's allowed me to shave every day without slicing up my face which is significant value add, and helps with offsetting the investment. Give yourself at least a few days to try out the shaver. I'm not sure if i believe it takes 3 weeks, but my shave has improved with every day of use. If you are thinking about switching to electric this is a great choice, buying the top of the line takes the guess work out of deciding if the problem is with electric's in general or just the cheap one that you bought.
  180. For many years I used a Braun 7570 shaver and received a great shave from a superior product. Every year or two I would replace the foil and blades and the shaver would be like new. It is no secret that the Braun series of razors are superior in quality and results. After using many other electric shavers I had finally found one that actually shaved my face and neck cleanly and comfortably. Recently, I was forced to replace my shaver after using it for at least 8 years. This was not due to any failure by the shaver, but because of a fire. Enter the Braun series 7-760cc. I am amazed on every level by this product. The most important quality in a shaver is the ability to get a clean, close shave. The Braun 760cc is unmatched,period! I have a very heavy beard and a very soft face. This razor shaves my face with ZERO RAZOR BURN! It works so well that I felt I needed to add to over 100 reviews that were already available. That's how good this razor is. I recently spent 2 weeks in India and I used this razor every day while I was there. It does not require a voltage converter or transformer to use it abroad, nor do you need to carry the cleaning base with you. Simply take the plug, and the razor which fits nicely in the attractive case that is provided with the shaver when you buy it. All you will need is the correct adapter to plug in to whatever outlet you have available, the built-in transformer will safely provide the correct voltage to charge your shaver. Having said this, I want to add that I did not charge this razor until my 15th day in India and that was simply so it would be fully charged when I returned home. That means the Braun shaver worked for 14 days without being charged once. When I am at home I use the cleaning base every day after I shave. The next morning, the razor is clean and fully charged. I have had this razor for a couple of months now (probably 3) and I have yet to replace the cleaning fluid. The indicator on the cleaning base has let me know by a yellow light that in the near future I will need to replace the cleaning solution, and there is another indicator that will tell me when this time finally arrives. The cleaning solution is easily picked up at Walmart or other department store. To wrap this up let me just say that I believe you will be very happy with this product and the use that you get from it for many years to come.
  181. great Razor and great price.
  182. Ordered on Sunday and arrived on Tuesday (2 days) with free super saver shipping. The shaver is a good quality unit, it doesnt feel like a plastic Taiwan made piece of junk and actually has some weight to it. I used it right out of the box after charging for about ten minutes and I was reluctant to decide if I made a poor decision on spending the money on this unit as it was a little rough being \\"dry\\" out of the box and didnt quite do the best job. However, I have faith in good engineering and quality products and coming from Germany I refused to believe that I just bought junk. So I thought about it for a minute and decided to run it through the cleaning station and then tried again, this time it was much smoother! The cleaning system really does clean and \\"lubricate\\" the shaver, you can tell the difference in the drag on your face and even just running your finger across the foil it has a nice glide to it. This shaver is extremely close to a razor shave and has met and exceeded my expectations with the exception that my neck is a little trickier to get to due to the grain running in a different directions. This will vary for most people though and should not scare you away from trying this shaver. For me it will be used on a regular basis to keep cleaned up during the week unless I have the time and need for a super clean razor shave. It isnt a perfect shave, but is very close and no electric shaver ever is perfect. The base station is plastic, not really cheap plastic, but still plastic. For the money (180$ +) I think it could use a little more thought and could be made a little heftier to accent the shaver, but it still works well and fulfills its purpose. The cleaning system is awesome! I ordered the 7 series partly because it offers heated drying after cleaning vs the lower models (5 and 3 series)only drip drying. I am glad I did and think it is well worth getting the cleaning system with heat drying. From what I hear the cleaning solution is about 5$ per container and sold in three packs for around 15$. I think the price is a little steep but the solution is worth it to keep the system in top shape for a comfortable shave. I am probably going to look for a bulk buying method online to avoid retail markups. So far im happy with my purchase and the thought of knowing it will save me money vs buying disposables and cut the time of shaving down considerably. Hopefully for the price it continues to be a quality product with many years of service ahead.<br /><br />Pros...<br />1) Great quality<br />2) Lots of features<br />3) As close to a razor as can be<br />4) Self cleaning, lubricating, and heated drying<br />5) Save money in long run<br />6) Made in Germany<br /><br />Cons...<br />1) Price (High up front, but worth it in the long run)<br />2) Base station a little cheap and neglected<br /><br />I only gave a three star rating for first impressions as I have not tested long enough to find or not find any flaws in it. And dont want to cheat anyone by giving it more.
  183. Great razor! Shaves close and smooth! Does not &#34;buzz&#34; as loudly as my older models. Stays charged a long time-- could not be happier! HIghly recommend!

I splurged and purchased the 7 series. Wow! A MUCH closer shave. Also the self-cleaning system got the razor incredibly clean. I have no complaints.
