  190. I should have bought this thing years ago. Recently scoured reviews, then bought one. Seriously, as close as a blade. I've used it for 2 weeks now and it's so impressive that I actually look forward to shaving in the morning! I've always shaved AFTER my shower whether using a blade or electric. Braun recommends shaving BEFORE you wash. I can say from experience that I don't think it matters, this shaver could not possibly get any closer. Maybe they expect less possible irritation if you shave BEFORE you wash, but I couldn't be happier with the quality of the shave AFTER my shower. Just make sure your skin is dry. Every morning I have a shaver ready that is fully-charged, cleaned, lubricated, and even has a hint of lemon smell in the shaver head! Spend the extra money and buy this Mercedes of shavers...it may be the last shaver you'll ever buy.
  191. I believe that everyone has a different type of facial growth. Because of this I can only give an opinion for my face. I have a face with scattered growth. My chin is probably the only place I have dense growth. I have been shaving for over 30 years. I started with a blade. I usually had irritation and bloody spots on my neck. I then started using a norelco. It was okay. Last December I bought this razor and was amazed. It cut as close as a razor on my face. I did have to really put some effort into it and push hard for my neck, but I also had to do that with my norelco. The result left me with a razor smooth face. Again, this is for my type of face. I have had no problems with the razor and I believe it is very easy to keep clean. I do enjoy having the cleaner. My face gives it five stars.
  192. First of all, no electric razor is ever going to give me as close of a shave as I can get with a blade. I decided to purchase an electric razor for economic reasons. Yes, I think I can spend less money by buying an electric for $200 and using it for six years than I spend buying refillable razor cartridges. Those blades only last me, at most, 10 days, and they are extremely expensive. So I bought the latest and greatest Braun hoping for good things. It has been about 15 years since I had used an electric razor. I figured that the technology would have advanced a lot since then given how much technology has advanced with the standard blade. I guess I was mistaken. I even spent the extra money to get a high end model with the hopes that it would yield better results. I'd be lying if I said I wasn't a bit disappointed. First and foremost, shaving with a blade is faster. I have to go over my whiskers several times in order to get a decent result. To achieve a good, close shave, I have to spend ten minutes with the electric, and I keep a goat-tee. If I had to shave the mustache and goat-tee area, I suspect it would take me more than twenty minutes to do a good job. Now there are some positives. For one thing, the shave that I get with this razor is comfortable. I also love the self cleaning system. That was always one of my big hangups with electrics in the past. I hated cleaning them. But I think that the greatest advantage of all is that it is economical. If I figure that I spent $200 on this razor along with $4 every six weeks to buy a new cleaning solution and $30 every 18 months, I will have spent about $320 after six years when the Braun company says I will have to replace it. This is compared to spending between $100 and $150 a year on refillable cartridges using my old Gillette Fusion. I think that the choice is obvious. Gillette Fusion gives a much closer shave, but it costs about twice as much. UPDATE: I'm updating my review a few daysafter writing the original to relay that I have discovered the wonders of a pre-shave treatment option that has miraculously turned this shaver into something that actually works. Now I still don't think it shaves as good as a blade, but I think I can give it at least four stars. I found a pre-shave oil at Wal-Mart that costs about $3, so I used that this morning. The effect was a really clean shave with about half as much work. The problem is, I don't like my skin feeling oily. So I ordered another product off of Amazon that isn't an oil so I have a couple of options before I decide what I like the best. They also sell some powders as well. My advice is, if you shave with an electric, check out some of these products.
  193. Bought this shaver for my husband and he he likes it. The holder does take up some space in our bathroom cabinet so I had to do some rearranging. You need space for it when it is cleaning. But that is our problem since we do not have a bathroom counter around the sink area. Other wise I would recomend it.
  194. Don't miss my \\"IMPORTANT\\" note below....but first my review:<br /><br />Sadly, this is the worst razor I've ever used. I loved my 8985. I'd give this 7-760cc zero stars if Amazon allowed it. I may just go ahead and pay (a lot) to have my old one repaired since this new model is so bad.<br /><br />What makes it so bad? Well, it doesn't work worth a darn. First of all, it feels more like you're trying to remove your beard using an electric sander...but one with so fine of sand paper that it doesn't take off the beard, but still irritates your skin. I suspect the problem is that the holes in the screen are noticeably smaller than previously, and my hairs simply don't fit through them well enough to get cut. Because the head is a new design, I can't try my old screen to see if that is the cause. (I believe the series 5 is still interchangeable w/ my 8985, so I may try a new series 5 before I give up and get my 8985 repaired.)<br /><br />[[[**UPDATE 18-August-2013: The issue isn't the size of the holes; it's the cutter, which they've changed slightly. I just bought a 550cc locally, which uses the same cutter & screen as my beloved 8985. The 550cc was as bad as the 760cc, though not as uncomfortable. I then swapped the screen from my 8985. No change. I then swapped the cutter from my 8985 and it worked great. I also tried the reverse -- putting the new cutter & screen on my 8985, and it sucked. So, I think I MIGHT keep the 550cc, but I need to see if I can find some of the older designed cutters anywhere. If I'm stuck with the new ones, which have thicker \\"blades\\" with less space between them, I might as well return my 550cc and stick with my el-cheapo Remington. (end of 8/18 update)]]]<br /><br />To give an example, I tried shaving my face as best as possible with the new razor -- taking TWICE as long as normal, causing some irritation, and leaving a far from smooth result. I then tried my 8985, which still limps along (motor seems to be failing -- inconsistent speed) and hasn't had a new cutter in about a year. Besides feeling so much more comfortable (almost soothing in comparison), it easily took off the rest of the beard. When I emptied the two razors into the sink, it was clear that the new one removed less hair than my old one did, going over my face after using the new one. THAT's pretty darn bad.<br /><br />As a side note, I have an old Remington that I paid $25 for about 5 years ago when I went out of town and forgot my Braun, and that $25 Remington, which is nothing great, does a much better job than this $160 Braun. In fact, that's what I'm using until I either find a new Braun I like or I get my 8985 repaired.<br /><br />IMPORTANT: If you decide to try it regardless of my opinion above, unless you are 100% positive you will be keeping this razor, pay attention to the fine print below the item (which I didn't see initially) -- IT IS NOT RETURNABLE TO AMAZON! See below chat:<br /><br />You are now connected to Narender from Amazon.com<br /><br />Me:Why can't I return my razor?!?! When purchasing, there was no mention of it not being returnable, PLUS, Braun has 60day money back satisfaction guarantee. I WANT MY MONEY BACK!<br /><br />Narender:Hello, my name is Narender. I will be happy to assist you.<br /><br />Me:Clearly, if Braun allows trying for 60 days, they don't expect the cleaner returned, and although I didn't open the cleaner that came with it, I can simply not include it if that is the issue w/ returning it.<br /><br />Narender:Let me connect you to a member of our Hard lines team. It will only take a moment.<br />A Customer Service Associate will be with you in a moment.<br /><br />You are now connected to Sammie G from Amazon.com<br /><br />Me:Are you able to see what I previously typed to the other agent?<br /><br />Sammie G:Yes, please give me a moment to go over the notes.<br />I understand you would like to return the Braun Series, but it is nonreturnable.<br />I'm truly sorry about this, what is the reason for the return?<br /><br />Me:Why isn't that stated when purchasing? And that goes against Braun's stated satisfaction guarantee that allows 60days to try it. I want to return it because it sucks. Worst razor I've ever used.<br /><br />Sammie G:It is stated on the detail page below the instock and details information. it states \\"Special Shipping Information: This item is non-returnable and is not available for 2-day shipping due to additional shipping requirements. See details.<br /><br />Me:Why can't I return it without the cleaning fluid? It's not flammable without it, and Braun clearly doesn't expect that back if they allow you to try it for 60 days.<br /><br />Sammie G:It does have a 60 day satisfactory guarantee with Brauns. you will need to contact Brauns I can certainly provide you with there contact information.<br /><br />Me:Their.<br /><br />Sammie G:Sorry, Their contact information.<br /><br />Me:Please do.<br /><br />Sammie G:One moment I'm pulling up their info.<br /><br />Me:I guess from now on I'll purchase my razors from Walmart.<br /><br />Sammie G:Braun/Gillette Phone: 800-272-8611<br /><br />Me:Thank you.<br /><br />Sammie G:You're welcome Frank! Is there anything else I may assist you with today.<br />?<br /><br />Me:No. That is all.<br /><br />Sammie G:You have good day! We look forward to seeing you again soon.<br /><br />ADDITION 8/12/2013:<br /><br />I contacted Braun, and on top of having to pay for shipping and insurance in order to return it to them for a refund, they said it could take up to 10 WEEKS to get the refund. I'm not a happy camper. Anyhow, in case it helps anyone else, here are BRAUN's instructions:<br /><br />Return razor, postage-paid, insured, with all packaging & parts EXCEPT the cleaning solution, and include the receipt showing price and date purchased, plus your name and address, and send it to:<br /> Returns Processing Center<br /> 4608 Appliance Drive<br /> Suite 2<br /> Attention: Braun 60day MBG<br /> Belcamp, MD 21017<br /><br />I don't see why AMAZON can't do the same thing: allow the item to be returned, less the cleaning solution (which is the core of the issue since it's flammable).

  199. There are only three reasons to buy an electric razor: save on blades, save time from buying blades or to avoid getting cut while shaving. Other than that blades, or manual shaving are superior--no one would argue that you can get as close as shave with an electric. The only thing they might say is \\"it is close to a blade.\\" With that said, I ordered the Braun 790. The thing has a whole lot of items to it and things you must buy to keep it going. Unlike the Braun of old when it actually was a German company which specialized in practicality and didn't try to milk customers into buying unnecessary things, Proctor & Gamble (the maker of Tide and Crest) bought them out and changed the game. Now you need to have this nasty alcohol solution cleaner--which must be repurchased every thirty days--in order to use your shaver. In the past Braun was designed to be cleaned with water and a brush. Furthermore, you need to replace the cutting block every year and a half for about forty bucks. So any money you might have saved by not having to buy blades is eaten up by Proctor & Gamble's desire to milk as much money as it can from you! Within a year and a half you will have spent nearly $400 to buy and maintain this razor--which will never shave as close as a blade and takes twice as long to shave as a blade. And unlike Panasonic which allows for shaving under water, Braun must be used dry which reduces lubrication and the closeness of the shave. All in all a raw deal, and therefore I am returning my Braun and realize the only thing this razor will help you get rid of is a lot of your money!

  213. I have used Braun shavers for over 20 years and every few a new design actually works substantially better than a prior design.<br /><br />Such is the case with this unit....But I reserve the right to change my mind after a few more months of use.<br /><br />Irritating: The unit assumes the cleanliness of the shaving head apparently based on the number of uses rather than actual cleanliness. I always dust the unit out after each shave so few, if any clippings remain, but based on the number of uses it adjusts the cleanliness rating. Maybe this wouldn't be an issue but the lower the rating the longer the cleaning cycle runs which exposes the cleaning fluid to more air and uses it faster.<br /><br />Good: Shaver controls allow adjustment of the speed of the cutter heads. Also the 3 heads move independently of each other as well as the entire head itself tilts to the angle of the face. This results in a much better shave and collects almost all of my neck hairs that tend to lay almost completely flat against my skin. Unit charges quite quickly and can be taken on trips without the base unit. The base unit is slightly larger than palm sized but vertically it is quite tall and removing the shaver head requires additional clearance (12\\" vertical space between shelves provides good access) So plan on a tall shelf or find a spot to place it on the countertop. The sideburn trimmer is deployed somewhat uniquely, use care as it doesn't appear to be as sturdy as prior designs, but it does seem more suited to the task of trimming sideburns. While charging the unit has LED's galore blazing a trail, but thankfully the LEDs shut off 10 minutes after cleaning or charging so they thankfully are off at bedtime.<br /><br />Overall after a month it works well and I am pleased with the results. Note that the 7 series and the 3/5 series units use different cutter technology so the 3 or 5 series may not deliver the same results. Also, there are 7 series shavers that do not include the \\"self cleaning\\" base which may ultimately be a better option for many.<br /><br />UPDATE:<br /><br />I have had my Braun now for 6 months and it has served me well over the months. (increased rating to 5 stars) It continues to deliver a close shave. Initially I had reservations about the \\"self cleaning\\" feature and cost of the unit but it does deliver a good consistent shave so it's a good investment if you dislike using a regular blade.<br /><br />#1 DO NOT just stick the shaver with all the whiskers in the unit and expect it to clean well. You will just clog the base and waste your money.<br />#2 After shaving (every use) pop the cutter head off the base and tap in the sink and run water through it removing any loose hairs. Gently shake off excess water. replace head, and return to charger.<br />#3 Every 2 or 3 days after doing this start the cleaning cycle this solution through the unit and drys it. This is when you notice a refreshed closeness of shave.<br /><br />Some additional comments.<br /><br />A The unit has some alcohol based cleaner in the cartridge (smells like rubbing alcohol with some additives. This naturally evaporates over time, but the little daily rinse adds a few stray drops to replenish back some of the liquid that evaporated. Ultimately, I replaced the cartridge not because it was low but after 5 months it had accumulated a good bit of shavings (even with my daily rinse).<br /><br />B The shaver does have an adjustment for how close the shave will be. START OFF with the least aggressive setting, or you may have a bit of rash from the shave. Mine was minor for a couple days.<br /><br />C Travel with the shaver by taking the power adapter without the cleaning base.<br /><br />D After market cartridges sold by different vendors are apparently \\"gray market\\" items. The cleaning solution I bought at a national retailer has lasted just like the solution that came with the unit.

  229. I got this for my son and his impressions follow. In short, this is the best electric shaver ever! There is not a single feature of this product I would change; Braun hit it out the ballpark on this one. The shaver is powerful and makes quick work of my beard, even if I haven't shaved for a few days. It gives a close shave without any razor burn or discomfort; something my old Phillips shaver could not provide. In my opinion, the only thing that will shave closer is a straight edge razor; something I'm not daring enough to attempt. I am able to shave without first using an electric pre-shave lotion on my face; another thing my Phillips could not do, as it would pull some whiskers or badly irritate my skin.<br /><br />When the Braun is used in conjunction with an electric pre-shave lotion, the results are identical as if I had shaved with a traditional foam and multi-bladed razor. The cleaning system is fantastic! This is the only shaver system that uses an alcohol-based cleaning solution that leaves the shaver out-of-the-box new with a fresh lemon scent every time. Another great feature is that the cleaning solution is self-contained, so once it is used up you can empty the container and recycle it (or just throw it away if you cannot empty the contents). Although the cleaning solution replacements are more expensive than my old shaver, they provide much greater performance. I purchased two replacement cleaning solutions at a local big box store for $12 and each one lasts approximately 2 months. I do not seem to have the issue with rapid evaporation of the cleaning solution as other users have reported. I live in a sub-tropic climate and the higher humidity probably inhibits the rapid depletion of cleaning solution others have noted.<br /><br />Unlike most other shavers, this one can be charged without the cleaning base, as there is a port on the shaver itself in which to plug it. I'm never on a trip long enough to need to recharge the shaver before I get home (I've used it 5 days in a row without charging and it displayed 40% charge remaining) but, it is nice to know that it is available.<br /><br />Another great travel feature is the sturdy case that is included. My old shaver came with a flimsy fabric sleeve that offered zero protection. Braun provides a rubberized, hard plastic case that will help prevent any damage to the shaver by even the roughest of luggage handlers. The only drawback to this product is the price; it is 2-3 times the price of competing units. However, this high price is easily justified as Braun has made a product far superior to any other shaver on the market.get home (I've used it 5 days in a row without charging and it displayed 40% charge remaining) but, it is nice to know that it is available.<br /><br />Another great travel feature is the sturdy case that is included. My old shaver came with a flimsy fabric sleeve that offered zero protection. Braun provides a rubberized, hard plastic case that will help prevent any damage to the shaver by even the roughest of luggage handlers. The only drawback to this product is the price; it is 2-3 times the price of competing units. However, this high price is easily justified as Braun has made a product far superior to any other shaver on the market.

  232. [[ASIN:B003YJAZZE Braun Series 7-760cc Pulsonic Shaver System, Black and Silver]] My father used Remington shavers all his life. I have used Remington Electric shavers all my life. I can't do the shaving lotion/non electric blade approach because it is too tough on my skin. The Remington shaver performs as advertised -- a good shave at a value cost. However, after shaving with that brand for 35 years, I asked myself -- Can I get a better/closer electric shaving experience? I read the reviews of the Braun shavers and decided to spend the additional money over the Remington to buy a Series 7-760cc Pulsonic. I can honestly say, the additional money is worth it! The shave is incredible. The incremental cost/day for this shaver is well worth the final cut.

We have two of these in the house. The first was bought for my husband. The second for my son this Christmas. Would only purchase the 700 series! Don't waste your time or money or any lower series.
  235. My boyfriend has always been a razor and shaving cream user, until he met me and my sensitive face. For as long as I can remember, my dad has always used Braun electric razors, so I knew I had to get a Braun for their dependability. Boyfriend could only shave his face about every 2 or 3 days due to ingrown hairs and razor burn. I decided to do as much research as possible on the newest Braun electric razors. This works like a charm in getting rid of all the stubble and keeping his face clear of razor burn and ingrown hairs, I can even brush up against his face without getting a rash. This was not only a present for him but a present for me as well! WARNING...if your bathroom is close to your bedroom don't put the razor into be cleaning base before bedtime; it can be quite loud depending on which cleaning cycle the base choses to use.

  237. Revision. Close, great working shaver. But: we've had two charging stations fail. Now Braun is part of mega corporation Proctor and Gamble, as in Customer NO service and that's what you get if you try to get help. They purposely make it so hard that you tire and throw in the towel. There are closer shavers out there i.e. some of the higher line Remington, and especially higher line Panasonic. The 7 series is perhaps Braun's best shavers but they were German made and of high quality. We don't expect that to last with the new non responsive customer relations. We're told the 9 series is worse as they don't provide a close shave as that of the 7. Why pay that much for a shaver and cleaner when you can buy something better for comparable pricing? Bottom line: Not recommended.enty long, both good attributes. Good ergo, fit and operation. This is a good upper line shaver. Is it worth the big buck outlay? You'll have to decide. Sale pricing is a good incentive when available. Amazon pricing is very hard to beat and they have sale prices all the time so it never hurts to wait if you're not in a hurry. If you are, you won't get burned by the normal prices. Pros: Close shave, quiet, very comfy. Cons: Foil/Cutter assembly can not be easily cleaned and should not be separated. Bottom line: Great overall performance, worth the money if on sale, One of their best shavers. Disclaimer: This review is written for information purposes only. It is not a venue for debate. Any abusive or argumentative responses will be reported and deleted.

  241. After reading the wonderful reviews about this product I decided to give this shaver a shot. I have been looking for a product for a long time so that I could get rid of the blade, and start shaving more often.<br /><br />I have medium coarse hair, very sensitive acne prone skin and I have never used an electric shaver before.<br /><br />After using it for the first time all I can say is WOW. It didn't feel like anything, I almost feel like I'm cheating the system! I did have to trim my beard down to a 1 in order for it to work better. I haven't shaved in 2 weeks, so it isn't a big deal (to me at least.)<br /><br />I had no knicks or cuts. I didn't feel any pulling at all. The shave feels just as close as using a razor without the redness and irritation afterwards.<br /><br />The trimmer is semi-inconveniently placed, but if you know how to work a mirror it is no problem and definitely not game-breaking.<br /><br />The cleaning base is great, it is not too loud like other reviewers stated. It basically sounds like the shaver when it is on, which is not loud at all, and very convenient.<br /><br />I am never going back to a razor again after using this.<br /><br />Ladies ( I didn't forget about you! ) It makes a great gift and I would recommend this to anyone I know.<br /><br />The only thing I regret is not paying for faster shipping, I could have been using this thing for that much longer. Instead I had to wait a week!<br /><br />Cheers,<br /><br />-Kenny.<br /><br />Edit 9 months later:<br /><br />Not a single problem. Still using the product still works great. The cleaning system still works great and I love how easy it is.<br /><br />Not as sharp as when it was new, starts to pull a tiny bit (cmon be a man) but I put some good use to it. Probably have to buy a new head, but its no big deal because my face has been cut free for nine months and has helped my acne. I will continue to use the product.

  264. I have owner this shaver for almost 4 years. It produces excellent shaves - equivalent to or better than a manual razor. When I first used it, I got 6-8 shaves per charge. Now I get 8-10 shaves per charge. My practice is to use it until the battery dies, then charge it. If I need to finish a shave, I plug it in for the last minute or two. It takes me about 4-6 minutes per shave depending on my beard. I used to manually shave a couple of times per year. Now maybe once per year. I use this shaver daily. The cartridges last at least 18 months but I change it every 2 years. I used the cleaning system only when the shaver has discharged, since it charges the razor as well. Since I travel a lot, it sometimes get cleaned with water.<br />The clean and renew system is expensive if you replace the cartridge when needed. They do not last long - at first maybe 18 charges, the second cartridge only about 10 times. I realized the cartridge appears to be alcohol and although not recommended (and could void a warranty), I refill the cartridge with 70% or 91% isopropyl alcohol available in a drug store for about $1 or $2 a bottle (you can many refills per bottle!). Even though they last only about 8 cleans, it's much (!!!) cheaper to refill. The shaver cleans fine and I have never had a problem while doing this for the last 3 years.<br />The only real problem I had was with the trimmer - which is not well designed. After about 2 years, it got stuck and only partially closes. I have to hold it down to shave. The spring is not set right and I could not fix it. After another year, a plastic piece broke off and it now doesn't work at all - still have to hold it down to shave. I am considering having it repaired, but cannot get an estimate without paying $35 for the repair company to look at it. May purchase the new 790.<br />Overall it's a great shaver and if you can live with the trimmer issue, you'll love it!!
  265. When buying shavers in the past, I had always wondered who would pay the high price for this shaver. After going through several cheaper shavers I finally decided to give this one a try.   277. Amazing razor (I'm coming from a 5 series) and I have no problems with it whatsoever. I love how I can clean with running water now as well (couldn't with my 5 series). I would love to use it in the shower but I am getting conflicting information regarding this. Braun's dedicated 7 series webpage states:<br /><br />100% waterproof and fully washable<br />Braun shavers have a fully sealed body and can be rinsed quickly and easily under running water. For optimal convenience, you can use the Clean & Renew™ system to clean your shaver at the touch of a button.<br /><br />However, only the 790 model shows &#34;wet/dry&#34; shave in its features, while the 760 does not. So I e-mailed Braun support and got a response (below):<br /><br />Thanks for contacting Braun, German.<br /><br />We appreciate your interest in the Braun shaver. I will be sharing your interest with the rest of my team.<br /><br />All Series 7 shavers are fully sealed and waterproof for full washability, however the<br />Series 799cc is the Wet&Dry model that can be used for a comfortable dry shave or a refreshing wet shave in the shower<br /><br />Thanks again for writing!<br /><br />Kenesha G.<br />Braun Team<br /><br />I would think that if the 760 is fully sealed like the 790, then why NOT bring it into the shower considering it's got the EXACT same head as the 790 series?? See my point? Is Braun trying steer its customers to their more expensive 799 with it's &#34;exclusive wet/dry feature&#34;? Sounds fishy to me. So for now I will not bring it into the shower or let my wife try it on her legs in the shower. I will reply to support with my ongoing concern and post their response here as I've noticed there were many questions surrounding the 760's waterproofness.

  281. I have been using a Braun 8985 for the last several years and have replaced the cutter and foil at least once. It was a good razor but I frequently felt a whisker get yanked several times during every shave. That got better after a while, or I got used to it and knew how to hold the razor to minimize it. I shaved with this razor (Series 7-760cc) one time and never felt one painful yank! It was the smoothest and cleanest shave I ever had. I would say I have a medium thickness beard, not very dense, but I have very sensitive skin. This razor is not only powerful but quite gentle. The angle of the shaver head makes it very comfortable in my hand. I'm glad I decided to upgrade. It's worth every penny. Highly recommended.
  282. I love this shaver. I must admit that I have never used any electrics but Brauns my entire life, so I can't compare it to the other brands. But, this is my third Braun in 20 years, and the first two were quite good, so I stuck with them. This one is just excellent. Both of my previous ones gave good close shaves, but this one does just as good a job with practically no irritation at all. I think it must be that the foil screens are spring-loaded. When I am done shaving with this 760, my face feels so good (compared to before. With my older Brauns, I used to have to put on aftershave to cool my skin off).<br /><br />I have never owned a shaver with a cleaning system before. I really like it and I think it works pretty well. I must reiterate someone else's comments on how to prolong the life of the cleaning solution. I only clean the shaver once per week in the system. The other times, I just run the shaver under the faucet. The morning after I use the cleaning system (about 24 hours after), I take the shaver out of the cradle, then open the cleaning system, carefully remove the cartridge, and put the plastic cover back on (make sure you don't throw away the cover when you open it the first time). Since it is alcohol-based, most of the reason it will get too low within a month is simply due to the solution evaporating. You want to wait 24 hours after cleaning to do this because you want all the solution that was running through the system to dry out. My current cartridge was opened in mid-June, and more than two months later, the light indicator is still showing that my solution level is full! With this method, I can probably get a good 4-5 months out of one cartridge!
  283. Well-built - much better than my prior razor (Braun 3 Series). Because of my prior experience, i wasn't going to buy a Braun, but the reviews for this razor were overwhelmingly positive. I've been extremely pleased so far with it's build quality and the smooth shave it delivers...

The 760 is all black instead of the 790 gray shaver and a black base. Is this a fashion statement, I like it all black!<br /><br />3. A quick clean button. Unless you're in a dormitory and it's the community shaver (yuk), who needs it? You shave in the morning, rinse it under the tap and put it in the bath tub and mash the clean button.<br /><br />The 760 has an LED display with 100%, 80, 60, 40, 20%. When you give it a bath, it's always at 100%! And it doesn't have the other 2 useless features of the 790<br /><br />So, for anyone looking at both the 790 (799, money's no object) and the 760, the 760 is the better deal by far the best deal.<br /><br />Go 760CC!

  291. My dad always used electric Norelco shavers. When it came time for me to get my first shaver, I went out to the store and bought a Remington foil shaver. It was awful, didn't work well for me at all. My dad told me I should have bought a Norelco. So I went and bought one, it worked great compared to the Remington, and I turned in to a Norelco believer. Been using them for 15 years now, and for the most part have been very satisfied. The Norelco's have always been very quick, quiet, and have done a passable job. I wouldn't say the shaves were great, but decent enough.<br /><br />It wasn't until recently I was thinking about replacing the blades on mine, when I decided that I was curious what else was out there. My previous shaver was around $120, so definitely nice and above average, but not top-of-the-line. I decided I was going to splurge on a top-of-the-line electric shaver to see what it's like. It came down to this vs one of the Norelco 3d models. I wasn't sure if I wanted to try a foil shaver since my experience with the Remington was not ideal (though it was a cheapie and 15 years ago), but after doing some reading online, I decided to take a chance and try a different brand and different type of shaver.<br /><br />Boy am I glad I did. My very first shave with this thing and it is shocking to me how smooth my face is. Never, not even when they were brand new, did either of my Norelco's shave this close. I genuinely can't tell the difference between the shave I got from the Braun and what I would get from an actual razor. It's really that good... I would argue that it's actually better just because of the convenience factor. It also doesn't struggle with hair on places like my neck, which the Norelco would take several passes to deal with.<br /><br />So I guess with electric shavers it is different strokes for different folks, I was a norelco rotary fan and thought I would be for life, but very glad I decided to try something new because it turns out it is significantly better than what I was used to, and quite frankly, I don't see how it could get much better than this.

  296. I have not regretted purchasing this product; it is quite excellent in terms of fit and finish. I have owned the Braun series 7505 shaver for roughly 12 years and I am accustomed to the reputable quality of Braun shavers. This was an easy purchase that didn't leave me with any regrets: the overall ergonomic design is designed for easy handling and doesn't produce any strain like the 7505 model. Additionally, I prefer the design of foil design as compared to the rotary type blades featured by Norelco products. These provide a more close and adaptive shave. I also appreciate the new design of the shaving head block: the razor detaches from the mounting system enabling ease of cleanup. The shaver comes with a cleaning/charging stand that provides a nice cleanup. As this is a Braun shaver the head can be detached for cheaper cleaning under the faucet. There is a nice led display that features the overall charge available.<br /> My criticisms are slight, but noteworthy: (1) cleaning pods are expensive, (2) the company is hard to contact regarding technical issues and repair opportunities. The cleaning pods need to be replaced and purchased from other vendors, there is no discount option for buyers. The company has reduced it's dealer repair network forcing one to contact their head facility in Boston, if you happen to live on the East Coast. Overall good shaver with minor concerns.
  297. I thought my previous Braun shaver (5 series) gave a pretty close shave but when this one arrived I did an A/B comparison and the new model definitely got the wife's seal of approval. I don't know what goes on inside this strange-looking cleaning and lubricating device but it seems to work pretty well. It also smells good, like an old-time barber shop. A small point but one that show's Braun's attention to detail. The brand name inspires confidence.<br /><br />This is definitely the closest electric shave I have ever had.
  298. I love the razor. The cleaning station is something that I will not use and don't need. Over the top and who wants to replace the solution?
  299. I never knew how bad all of my previous cheap razors were until I bought this one. The charge indicator is a nice touch. It's unusually quiet for a foil style shaver, by far the most quiet of any that I've ever used by a wide margin. I'm not a fan of rotary style shavers, get's closer than those I have used. My only complaint is that it doesn't get quite as close as some of the Remington micro foils that I've owned in the past. I don't know why, but I never quite get the same results from Braun that I have from Remington. Now I know, even Braun's top of the line doesn't get that there. However, I'm willing to look past that for all of the great features and performance of this model.
  300. This is my fourth Braun shaver in about 15 years. Been using this one for 10 months. It's both good and bad.<br /><br />Pros:<br />* Very close shave. Easy does it or it can cause razor burn, especially on high setting.<br />* Three speed settings are a nice touch.<br />* Very quiet out of the box. (beware, read my cons)<br />* Operates while charging, unlike Braun's wet/dry versions that only operate unplugged.<br /><br />Cons:<br />* Center scissor blade badly pulls mustache, beard, and sideburn hair. It hurts a lot!<br />* Hair trimmer is weak and awkward. The older style trimmer (as on Series 3) is much better.<br />* After 10 months of light use, the center scissor blade is extremely loud, enough for ear plugs on the highest speed. Locking the pivoting head quiets it down but negates a major design feature of the shaver.<br />* The foil/cutter head is rated for 18 months. Mine was overdue for replacement after nine months. I easily got 18-24 months on my previous Brauns. I assume the problem is cost cutting.<br /><br />I'm on the fence about this shaver. I might buy a replacement foil/cutter. Then again, I might apply the money towards a new shaver from a different manufacturer. I think I'm done with Braun for what they cost since most are made in China now.<br /><br />*** UPDATE ***<br /><br />I purchased a replacement foil/cutter head for the shaver that says Made in Germany. The new head looks about the same but weighs noticeably less than the original. The original is clean, by the way. The shaver is still very loud to the point of needing ear plugs. When the head is removed and the motor is turned on, it seems that motor assembly has probably gone bad (excessive vibration). There's no place anywhere around the MD/D.C. metro area for warranty support, with Braun's website showing the closest place about 400 miles away in Massachusetts. I'll contact Braun and see how it goes.<br /><br />For what it's worth, I suggest taking reviews here with a grain of saltunless the reviewer makes it clear that the shaver has been in use for at least six to nine months. That's about how long mine lasted.
  301. I've never been happier with the shaver its the best one I've ever bought. I would recommend this product to anybody give the closest shave of all the razors I've ever used plus the beard trimmer is a plus the battery indicator on the bottom is a plus and the cleaning solution keeps it working perfectly.
  302. This is an excellent shaver. I am an observant Jew, and we cannot use a razor blade on our face. Therefore, I have had many shavers over the years and this Braun Series 7-760 shaver is the best I have ever owned. It gives a comfortable, close shave which lasts all day long. This, I attribute to the foil head; I prefer the foil head over the rotary heads. I also appreciate the fact that it has a cleaning/disinfectant cycle. That is a great feature in itself, and it works well. GREAT SHAVER - GREAT PRICE!!! I am not in the least bit disappointed in this shaver.
  303. The shaver does not shave as closely as a decent razor. You have to go over the same area more than once, but not excessively, like some other electric shavers. It gets most hairs, but does not shave them extremely close. It is obviously not a razor close shave, but it is very good for a lazy quick shave or as a touch-up shave for the next few days after a razor.<br /><br />I'd recommend this for anyone who does not need a razor close shave every day, or for someone whose face gets too irritated by shaving with a razor every day. It has multiple speed settings on it, but I always keep it on the highest setting because lowering it doesn't seem to be of any benefit and I have no discomfort from the highest setting. The trimmer that comes with it is excellent for sideburns or mustache or beard EDGING, but is difficult to use for trimming a week's worth of growth before a full shave.<br /><br />The shaver is not overly loud, but it is also far from quiet. The self clean function gets it quite clean, but after you start it, it has to finish the cycle and drip fully dry before you use it again. If you don't let it completely dry, the cleaning solution that is left on the shaver can burn your face. One benefit of this shaver it is you can use it while it is plugged in, so if you forget to charge it, it's no big deal.

Given that Braun is a foil shaver, I believe they are the best shavers for people with very sensitive skin. It was sudden and random, but I figured spending $120 (with 2 foil replacements) over 5 years wasn't too bad of an investment.<br /><br />This shaver feels AMAZING! it cuts so smoothly, it doesn't catch and pull on hairs. it just mows over them and you don't feel anything. afterwards my skin feels just fine and there's no raw itchy feeling.<br /><br />I love this shaver, I hope it stands the test of time.

  326. I didn't think anything was going to be better when my Norelco shaver which gave me a very good shave. I was wrong. This shaver is just about as good as a blade, maybe the same, without all the fuss and was even better than the Norelco. I like the idea that it cleans itself so I do not have to bother. Once set up, after shaving you just put it back in the cleaner holder. The holder tells you how much cleaning will be necessary and the amount of cleaning fluid is left. Then you just push a button.The directions said that if you were changing from a rotary shaver it may take two weeks to see perfect results. Actually, it took less time. The shaver is fast and you can even adjust the intensity of the shavers cutting action. Yes, it is somewhat pricy and getting refills for the cleaner adds to the costs, but you use it almost every day and I find it well worth the extra costs.

  365. All my life, I have been a proponent of traditional wet shaving using a multi-blade cartridge. I would occasionally use a rotary electrical shaver for convenience, but never could get the smoothness of a traditional wet shave. I have a thick beard that seemed to chew through razors quickly, and I have a goatee that I have to navigate around, but also keep trimmed.<br /><br />Recently, all of the newer cartridge shaving systems have gone to these humongous multi-blade monstrosities (some have 8 blades!!) that make it difficult for me to shave around my goatee and the replacement blade prices have gone sky-high. So I decided to explore alternative solutions. My requirements were:<br /><br />1: Close, smooth shave. Nothing beats a blade; but the electric razor had to come pretty darn close and satisfy my rigorous requirements of no scratch when I drag my hand against my beard.<br />2: Shave around my goatee: I needed something that would come up close to my goatee without grabbing it and painfully yanking the hairs.<br />3: Decent trimmer: I need to trim my goatee, hairs in my ears and around my nostrils without pain. Also need to periodically trim some of those obscure sideways-growing neck hairs that hide in my neck wrinkles.<br />4: Quiet. I had to be able to have a comfortable conversation or listen to TV/Radio whilst shaving.<br />5: Travel-Friendly: I travel frequently and internationally. I needed something that was easy to pack, easy to clean, easy to recharge and wouldn't turn on accidently in the suitcase.<br /><br />I researched the web heavily, watched many youtube videos of each brand, talked to many department store demo &#34;dolly's, conferred with countless friends and acquaintances, and narrowed my search down to a few models that would meet most of my requirements. But the Braun Series 7 fit the bill perfectly.<br /><br />In addition to meeting 100% of the requirements above (and yes, it really does allow me to shave close to my goateewithout pain), it came with a few other nice surprises definitely worth mentioning:<br /><br />1: Fits nicely in the hand and comfortably shaves all facial areas. This is a relatively small/light razor compared to most of the other brands.<br />2: Comes with a super-cool cleaning/charging system that is not a gimmick ... it really does work! It is super easy to use and when finished, the razor comes out like jewelry. Note that when travelling, you just use the recharge cord and the hand-brush to clean the razor. Upon return from your trip, simply drop it into the cleaning system and it will tell you how dirty the razor is. Hit the button and the cleaning cycle starts.<br />3: Actually shaves those weird neck hairs!<br />4: Long time between charges. This probably will vary by user, but I take about 3-5 minutes per shave, and this razor lasts 2 weeks on a single charge (including trimming every other day or so).<br />5: Comes with a very nice and small travel case protecting it and preventing it from turning on in the suitcase.<br /><br />I couldn't be happier with this product ... even if Braun paid me. The price was right, performance after 3 months is still perfect and I have completely eliminated the use of cartridge razors. I actually demo my Series 7 to friends and have let them take it for a test drive (remember the cleaning system completely sterilizes between each use). They've become Series 7 fans too.<br /><br />Perhaps we should start a fan-club!
  366. Very smooth shave.<br />Very quiet.<br />Easy to clean.<br />Great for travel-numerous shaves on a single charge.<br />Easy to use trimmer.

  371. I've had a Braun 8585 for... as long as it had come out (8+ years?). I lost the charger on a trip to South America and decided to upgrade to the newest top of the line Braun. I didn't need the 790 so went down to the 760 after reading reviews from The Consumer Reports and The Wirecutter.<br /><br />I've used it for almost 2 months and just sent it in to the 60-day Braun Money Back Guarantee yesterday (Hope they actually get me a refund) because my old 8000 series shaved better for me. Here are couple of issues I've found.<br /><br />1) The shaving foil and the &#34;cutter&#34; inside are not flush against each other. I thought at first it was broken because I would try to shave like my old shaver and it wasn't shaving anything off. You have to apply quite a bit of pressure to get the cutter against the foil so it gets close to the skin/stubble.<br /><br />2) The ultrasonic &#34;vibrating&#34; head doesn't seem to do anything to me. It is actually a negative because I can't hear the shaver &#34;cutting&#34; my stubble nor can I &#34;feel&#34; it cutting. All I hear and feel is the vibrating head, no matter what level of vibration (3 different levels) I couldn't hear it shaving nor could I feel it. With my 8585 I could feel it shaving my stubble and I could somewhat feel when it was done shaving without having to pass my hand over my face. With the 760 even after I've done multiple passes I could still feel the stubble when I pass my hand over them. I would have to go through more than 3x of what I did with my old shaver. As per instructions I tried for at least 2 weeks (more like almost 2 months) and I saw no improvement.<br /><br />3) My skin began chafing after 3 weeks. Under my chin, my skin began to almost look like small pimples were forming at each stubble and the shaver was &#34;cutting&#34; them making my skin white (imagine a thin layer of skin being shaved at each stubble). I tried using pre-shave lotion to see if it would help. I tried shaving after a shower (Braun recommends shaving before shower, when your face is dry), and all different ways with no luck.<br /><br />Final Comments: I would guess if your skin is ok with it, it's not a bad shaver. And I can't say any other shaver is better because I didn't compare, I just ended up going back to my old Braun shaver by buying a charging cable for my 8585 from eBay (they are $120 new from Braun!! yikes!!) and my happy shaving continues.g after a shower (Braun recommends shaving before shower, when your face is dry), and all different ways with no luck.<br /><br />Final Comments: I would guess if your skin is ok with it, it's not a bad shaver. And I can't say any other shaver is better because I didn't compare, I just ended up going back to my old Braun shaver by buying a charging cable for my 8585 from eBay (they are $120 new from Braun!! yikes!!) and my happy shaving continues.
  372. I got a Braun electric razor model 6995 on June 9th, 2008, but in 2013, decided I would upgrade to a newer model. My wife bought me a Series 7-760cc Pulsonic Shaver in October 2013. After using the new razor for a few months and not being impressed in the closeness of the shave, I went back and tried my old model 6995. After switching razors for a few weeks, I definitely like the old 6995 the best. It gives a closer shave, and in less time. So the moral of this story, if the &#34;razor isn't broke&#34; and you like the shave, don't buy a newer version expecting to get a better shave. Of course, now that the return window has passed, I'm stuck with this 7-760cc razor, although I am going to keep shaving the the older, but better, model 6995.

  374. Gives a good clean shave, the cleaning system has been successful so far giving each use a clean feel without pulling of facial hair like some electric razors can have.

  378. Excellent razor. I have a thick coarse beard and it cuts through it with relative ease. A few double passes are necessary to catch the stragglers. I shave after showering and drying my face. It is a closer shave than my previous rotary razor. I have fairly sensitive skin, especially around the neck area and i receive very little if any irritation, especially if my skin is dry and the razor can glide over easily. I try not to shave daily so I can get a closer shave, but I have done so and only notice a small difference. The cleaning station is nice, I use it when I charge the razor (approximately every 4 weeks with shaves every other day). The battery life is great. We shall see how well it lasts.

  385. I splurged and bought the Braun Clean and Charge 7900 or whatever the model was, back in 2000 when they first came out. $200 was pretty ridiculous for an electric shaver at the time, but I bought it and loved it. I used it for over 10 years. It was the best shaver I had ever used. Sadly, after 10 or 11 years of use, it ceased to turn on. I soldered on some new batteries but it did not revive the shaver, my old friend. The whole system was flawless, cleaning system worked great the entire time, until finally the shaver died.<br /><br />So it was 2011 and I needed a new shaver. I looked at Braun's lineup and now they have all these cheaper models and don't bother to differentiate them other than using buzzwords. I thought I was being smart and responsible when I &#34;only&#34; bought the ~$115 370cc. I used that shaver for about 2 years, and it was terrible. It just felt weak and slow. It pained me to get rid of a new purchase, and throw good money after bad -- who knows, maybe the more expensive ones are terrible these days, too! So I suffered for almost 2 years with that thing, until the cutting foil needed replacing, and I wasn't going to put more money into this junk (the head is incompatible with the nicer ones.. the cartridges *are* compatible so I didn't mind 'investing' in those).<br /><br />I decided to splurge on myself with some Christmas money, and bought the 760cc (same as the 790cc I think, but I prefer the black color).<br /><br />I didn't even have to finish opening the packaging to know that this is the real deal. It's solid and smooth metal, it feels expensive. German precision. Not any heavier than my 370 but somehow feels nicer.<br /><br />5 seconds of shaving is all it took to realize this thing is a beast. The motor spins the cutter easily twice as fast, and the shave is simply amazing. It's obviously not fair to compare a worn cutter on my 370 to the new one on the 760, but I was never happy with the 370 and am thrilled with the760. That's all you need to know.
  386. My husband needs a shaver that won't cut his face, so I purchased this for him. He has repeated often what a good shaver this is. What more do I have to say?

Amazon was offering $15.00 insatnt rebate and $40.00 credit towards my next purchase of anything I bought from Amazon. This put the razor in range of what I wanted to put on an electric razor, which I was sure that I'd be returning. The reason I thought I'd be returning it, is that I'm 45 and have tried numerous electric shavers over the years and have never even had one come remotely close to giving up razor blades and shaving cream. I went about 3 days of not shaving before it arrived and when I used the razor after it arrived, I was truelly astonished. I've read reviews of it being noisy, but seemed pretty quiet to me. It knocked out the three days of stubble in less than 5 min., not once did it feel like it was yanking or pulling the hairs and didn't burn or cause any irritation to my skin. I was ready to write the review right then, but being the sceptic that I am decided to wait 30 days to be sure. In the meantime I discovered that the cleaning system was pretty great as well. I only use it after about 3 or 4 shaves and it cleans great and leaves it with an awesome clean smell. My brother inlaw came in for Christmas and used it and said he was going to get one as well and he's a bigger sceptic than I am. It has now been 30 days and I'm as happy with it as the first day I used it, I had heard comments made that it had made people actually look forward to shaving and I have to admit, I am one of those people now.

For me, that is the area where it is truly superior. I have cheaper electric shavers that seem to give an equally close shave.   459. This is my first electric shaver. I have been a blade user my entire life, but was getting tired of having to soak and lather my face prior to every shave. Dull blades, empty shaving cream cans were also a common problem and a hassle. I was worried about how close an electric would be able to get. For the first week of use I ran into a few issues. The shave quality was okay but not great. The shaver was also irritating my neck and causing lots of redness that was slow to disperse. After the initial break in period though (and with some changes to my technique), I am now getting a great shave from this device.<br /><br />What I have found to work is:<br />1). Don't push too hard. If the device feels overly hot, you are pushing it into your skin too hard.<br />2). Put in the time. I will usually do 2-3 passes over my face, working my way around clockwise in zones. It takes a little longer but gives a better shave.<br />3.) Angles. The neck has always been a problem area for me, and at first this shaver was not getting all of the hair on my neck. To get that close shave, try running the shaver across your face at different angles until you find which ones work for you. For me it is turning the blades vertical, and then running them across my neck in a horizontal fashion.<br /><br />My wife cannot tell the difference between the Braun and a blade now.<br /><br />+ Very close shave, nearly if not as close as a blade (if done right).<br />+ Comfortable to hold<br />+ Pop out trimmer is of a good size and position on the device.<br />+ The self cleaning base always keeps the razor clean and fresh<br />+ No more shaving prep work (soak, lather, etc)
  460. A significant improvement in technology over my several year old Braun. That said though, this one is virtually impossible to clean by hand with cleaning brush, due to construction of the head. I remove the head weekly, and blow it out thoroughly with a can of air, like you use on computers. Then I use the cleaning machine with the Braun cartridges every other week.If the stuff weren't so expensive, I'd use it every time!

You will end up passing over areas multiple times to get all of the hairs.<br /><br />Shaving performance just doesn't seem to reflect all of the technology utilized by this shaver. It will do the job, but you may end up getting frustrated making 5 or so passes over some areas of your neck to get all of the hairs.

  474. The best shave I have ever had using an electric razor. It's better than the Braun Series 5. I'm very satisfied.
  475. Takes 4-5 passes over same area. Braun has NO parts or repair closer than 1,000 miles. If a part fails, I must ship it to Mass. and wait for it to be fixed. Meanwhile, I have no shaver. Moustache/Sideburn trimmer is useless. Cost too much for dissatisfaction.
  476. This is a remarkable product - although it is bit pricey - it lives up to the Braun reputation - Tell your friends it is a great system
  477. It does not shave closely enough. I'm very disappointed that it does not shave more closely. I could never use it in place of a razor.
  478. Cannot be happier and satisfied with my Braun Series 7 shaver system, It does it all, you put it in the cleaner system and cleans, lubricates, dries and maintains the blades in optimum condition, it's been a while now shaving myself and it still works excellent like the first day ...love it!!!
  479. Did not meet expectations. I have a tuff beard and I don't get a satisfied shave.
  480. It was a present for my father. Worked well.
  481. its not been a month and i (the husband) can write a review since i have given it a fair shake. anyone going from a razer to an electric shaver should know taht no matter what electric shaver you get it takes a few weak of at least every other day use to get the best shave possible. your skin has to get use to it and the hair grows in a lil differently then it does from a razer shave. i know that i wont get as close a shave from an electric then i would a regular razer but im lazy and wanted something i can do at any time with out having to run hot water, wait for the hairs to soften (i have thick hair) so it was time to step it up. id say about 85 percent of the hairs you shave off actually stay inside the machine which i didnt expect so staying clean was a nice bonus. if a razer makes me feel 100 percent smooth then this thing makes me feel about 90 percent smooth which is close enough for me. it doesnt bite, smooth to use on any part of the face. if i had to buy it again i dont know if i would..not because it doesnt work well but i wonder if something for half the price can do the same job? if you have the money to blow then by all means yes buy it, its a great electric but i dont think it would hurt to try something cheaper first.
  482. Been using about a month now, and it is definitely the closest shave I have ever gotten with an electric shaver. Pricey but worth the cost, I just hope it lasts.
  483. I bought this for my husband who was strictly a razor man because of his heavy beard. But his face is sensitive and he had to shave every other day to avoid nicking and redness. Not only does this product do the job, but he has never been smoother after his shave and he can shave now everyday without the redness and nicks. It took him a few days to get used to the pivoting head and how best to angle it, but he is a champ now and the self cleaning aspect is great! He gets a clean, antiseptic shave every day that is closer than a blade. Shipping was fast and product came as expected. Price was $100 below retail. So I got a killer deal here. 5 stars!
  484. I have used a Braun 5-series shaver for the last 10 years, and I thought it was great. Replaced the batteries once. But it finally wasn't cutting as well despite changing heads. So I began looking around and naturally looked at Braun again. Frankly, I was put off at the cost of the newest Series 7 shavers and I was not impressed with the requirement for the cleaning and charging dock that would clutter up my sink area. But now even the new Series 5 shavers have the dock. And Braun's website has a nice comparison tool to see what your money is buying between the lower priced 5 and higher priced 7 series. Biggest difference seems to be the newest cutting system. But would it work? Was it worth the extra cost or is it a gimmick. Well, my wife settled the issue for me by purchasing the razor at a big box store for list price, but I had her return it because of the better Amazon price. So, now the test. Is it better? In two words, absolutely yes. First it offers 3 closeness settings, and they do really change the behavior of the razor so you need to try them to see what works for your face. The floating head really works to keep the screen at a very good cutting angle. The razor is very easy to use at odd angles to your face. My beard has kind of an oblique grain and to get the closest shave under my neck the razor must make a unique angle, and it goes very well. As far as cleaning, the blade cartridge is very complex especially compared to my old 5-series. While you can clean this razor by running it under water and using the included brush, it is really best cleaned as Braun designed it to be, in the docking station. So yes, the docking station is not a gimmick, but it definitely makes the razor work better. How do I know for sure? I took the razor on vacation cleaning it the conventional way and could see it wasn't getting as clean as it could. One trip to the docking cleaning station and it was like new. And did I mention that the razor is very quiet? I mean VERY quiet.<br /><br />I should also probably say that I religiously use the Afta product line of electric pre shave and after shave. These are creamy products rather than just liquid alcohol. Since I've always used them I cannot be certain if this influences the outcome for me versus someone else.<br /><br />So, in summary a bit pricy, but the shave is impressively smooth (as my wife will attest to), quiet and the docking station is not a gimmick. I hope that I can get 10 years out of this one too. It seems to be build like most Braun products, very solidly. Finally, this razor was rated tops by a leading consumer publication. Now I'm always suspicious about these ratings, but this product seems to live up to the score given it.<br /><br />Additional note, if you use a rotary razor and try a foil razor you'll probably never go back. Although it has been a while (my razor previous to the Braun 5 was a Norelco which replaced a disappointing Remington foil product, but that was probably 30 years ago) I have never regretted the switch to Braun foil razors. Of course every man's beard is different.<br /><br />Update 12/2012 - still on the original blade cassette. Braun says to change every 18 months, but I am past that now. Keeping the razor clean is essential. The cleaning system is very good at this but you still need regular manual brushing of the beard hairs from inside every once and a while. I still highly recommend this series of razor. My shave is as close as when new and takes no longer to shave.
  485. really good choice, i would recommend to all of you, also the price was really cheap heard its much more expensive in the mall
  486. I've had one of these Braun 'self-washing' shavers since they first came out...and this is only my second one! I've had it a couple months now and it works just as well as my first one (of which I can't remember the model, but like I said, it was one of the very first ones they made...it lasted for years). Shaves very close, I like the side-trimmer pop out, does a great job getting the shaver clean in between uses.<br /><br />Only thing I don't like is that the cleaning cycle takes a lot longer than my old model. Most of the time is spent drying...the old model had a fan that would blow dry it each time. I think this one uses some kind of heat so it's much quieter but takes at least twice as long.<br /><br />Still a great shaver though, hopefully I get several years out of this one as well!
  487. It met my expectations. Close shave and quite fast. Easy to clean and store. I would recommend7-760cc the Braun Series
  488. Updated Post May 2017:<br />I had purchased this Series 7 razor on December 2, 2013, replaced the razor head on June 23, 2015 and it Still Works Great.<br /><br />The original batter is still holding strong and the battery life is excellent. I travel full time and only take the charging cable if I am gone more than 14 days and have never had a problem. My facial hair is thick and heavy, so if I do go more than day without shaving it you can hear the razor struggle to cut through. However, it has never failed me. I have been getting a consistent shave, with every use for the last 3.5 Years!<br /><br />Original Post:<br />Perfect of Heavy on Thick facial hair. This razor is solidly built and feels like great machine in your hand; it has that same low hmmm of a barbershop razor. The foil and blades are much more substantial in quality and build than the Panasonic competition. The shave is near perfect; I could not be happier with this purchase.<br /><br />It comes with the cleaning station, which I thought would be a joke, but I am glad to be wrong. The case is perfect for travel, and provides total protection of the unit. If you for get to charge the razor, you can just use the power cord directly. Great product.<br /><br />I was really nervous dropping more than $100 bucks on an electric razor, but this thing is well worth it!

  497. My husband has been using this shaver for a few months and I have heard the sound change from good to bad in a short amount of time. It is making an unusually high buzzing sound as if it is on its last leg and my husband is complaining it is not shaving that well either. He has always used a Norelco and I bought this for his birthday and I do regret the purchase.
  498. After extensive research, I have been very pleased with the purchase of my Braun shaver. Close shaves, no major chafing, plenty of battery time, easy cleaning system, competitively priced. Overall good value. One of my better purchasing decisions.
  499. I am very curious about the ratings of this shaver system. I'm guessing that most of the reviews are done shortly after the shaver was received and put in service. I really wonder what people's response are to this shaver after a period of time. I've used my shaver for approximately 5 months now. I was quite impressed at how close a shave I received when I first got it. However, after a few months, it was taking longer and longer to shave and and the shave was getting less and less close. I clean my unit daily, so I know it doesn't have to do with lack of care. After 5 months, it's taking twice as long to shave as it did at the start--I go over my face again and again in differing directions, and the area on the left and right under my chin will only become close after a lot of abrasive shaving.<br /><br />On top of that, the differing directions required to get a close shave makes for an arduous task. I have finally concluded after spending a lot of money on this expensive unit that I am going to return to a Philips Norelco shaver. Even if it doesn't shave quite as close over the long haul, the more natural circular shaving motion is much more effective in clearing my face in a reasonable time and without as much abrasion. Also, I don't have to be staring in the mirror all the time to accomplish my morning ritual. In the end, given the reduced efficiency of the Braun over time, the Norelco and Braun shavers end up shaving about at the same level, and perhaps the Norelco even has the nod over the long haul.
  500. Works better than my previous shavers and for me that is saying a lot. I have curly whiskers which after two days growth have grown out a quarter inch or so and have curled in. They could be whiskers I just missed previously of new curved whiskers. I don't shave every day, I am retired. My previous shavers were the Remington and the Norelco. They both couldn't handle the curved whiskers a day or more after being shaved.
  501. Works as expected. Love it .
  502. My husband had a bad fall and ended up in the hospital a day before we received the shaver. Upon receiving it he was able to shave during his hospital and rehab time with wonderful results. He always preferred a different brand but is completely sold on this Braum model. This was a great purchase.
  503. I gave this to my boyfriend for Christmas, and despite having a skin condition that makes him break out after any shave, he was able to use this product.
  504. I had a Norelco 2D razor I bought two years ago. Although I had used Norelco shavers for over 30 years, I was not happy with this one. To trim your sideburns, you had to remove the razor head and attach a separate trimming head. It was impossible to clean, and there was no travel charger. You had to stick the razor, it's charging stand, and the separate trimmer into your bag.<br /><br />When the razor broke, I decided to look at the Braun Series 7 shaver. It got excellent reviews in the Wirecutter blog and at Consumer Reports. I wasn't sure about the cleaning system, but I saw in the manual I found on line that the trimmer was part of the razor and not a separate piece. Plus, it has a separate travel bag. This razor was also cheaper than the premium Norelco too, so I decided to try it.<br /><br />The shave is excellent. It's the closest cleanest shave I've had in years. I was first afraid that there would be some pull since I hadn't shaved in over a month, plus I had been using a rotary shaver before that. Normal experience tells me it takes a few weeks before your beard \\"adjusts\\" to a new razor. I used the trimmer to cut down my beard, and then shaved the rest. There was no pulling of beard hairs, and the shave was perfectly smooth. It was the best shave I've had in years.<br /><br />The only thing I noticed is that this vibrates quite a bit. Rotary shavers blades go around, and the shaver doesn't really vibrate all that much. The Braun blades go back and forth and cause the shaver to vibrate a lot more than I'm use to. I could especially tell while shaving my upper lip. For a while, I thought I was going to vibrate my teeth out of my jaw. However, if this is something I have to learn to live with in order to get such a nice shave, I shall do my best.<br /><br />The cleaning system is something I thought was pretty gimmicky when I first got it, but I've changed my mind. It does keep the razor clean. As a bonus, I don't have to waste my time cleaning it while I'm rushing off to work. I simply push the cleaning button, and let it do its thing. The next morning, I have a nice clean shaver that gives me a beautiful shave.<br /><br />I highly recommend the Braun shaver.
  505. Gave to my husband for Christmas. He says shaves better than any shaver he's ever had. According to prices of other shavers, this was reasonable, but it is still pricey. My only 'beef' with it is the loudness of the cleaning cycle.
  506. Call me crazy, but I have tried this product several times and really wanted to make a series 7 shaver work for me. This shaver with the factory optifoil cartridge is garbage (2 star product at best). I went out and bough an old smart foil cartridge from ebay (blue cutting strip) and it makes the shaver work much better. Combined with aramis pre electric shave solution and this is a 4 star shave, not perfect but pretty good. Cleaning system is fantastic. That being said, I still prefer the Panasonic es8243 with billy jealousy hydroplane shave gel (easily a 5+ star shave and the best I have found, and yes I have tried them all). I have a thick beard with super sensitive skin if that helps.
