  516. Jury's still out, but the pros are that it is easy to use and a snap to clean. All you have to do is insert the shaver into the holder like the picture and push a button; it goes through a on/off wash and dry cycle and is ready whenever you are for the next shave.<br /><br />I used to shave with a razor and still think it gives me the best shave. But razor shaving is a little messy and takes longer. Although I've been using the Braun for only about 2 weeks, I still have a rash on the tender part of my neck from using it, even though I set the shaver to delicate. Maybe I will get used to it over time.<br /><br />Bottom line, I will continue using it because it is fast and easy; and it does a decent job of shaving my face.
  517. The boys love them! Great dealing with this company. Work awesome!
  518. main part made in Germany, seat made in Hungary, liquid in north EU, everything makes it perfect! supereme quality. Love it!
  519. The best electric shaver I have ever owned.<br />I have been using electric for 30 plus years<br />and this is the best!
  520. I had a 5 year old Series5 shaver that started going haywire last year where the shaver could not be turned off at low battery levels and had to be opened up to create a short circuit near the battery terminal to shut it off and I decided to give Braun one more chance after reading reviews that this shaver is actually made in Germany and not China. The new batteries are lithium-ion unlike the NiMh in the old shaver and the 760 comes with a 60day moneyback satisfaction guarantee. The motor is much quieter and the shave is incredibly close and fast. Has 3 different settings depending on how tough the hair is and what area is being shaved. Cleaning is a breeze. I could not be happier and hopefully this lasts a few years to come. Save the extra money over the 790 and get the 760. They are both the same shavers.
  521. After shaving with a razor for many years, then trying and currently on my second Norelco shaver, I've been pleased, but not too pleased on the norelco. The only benefit, not cuts or bleeding for the razor, but I have to go over and over with a Norelco and then sometimes even use a razor to get those hard spots. I've been eyeing this unit up and saw it on sale here! I just got it today and WOW.... I cannot remember my face been so smooth, especially under my nose! I cannot believe how close this thing shaves, I will never look back now! PROS: Closest shave EVER!!! Self-Cleaning NO Shaving cream CONS: Expensive (but not really if you find it at a low price, like I did here on AMAZON!) $155 A little loud when cleaning (not a big deal, It can wait till I get home so I don't make noise in the morning) Refills (Just buy them here and you'll save TONS) BOTTOM LINE: This is worth EVERY penny and I am glad I found it on sale here! I was skeptic after having two Noreleco rotary type shavers and they did not get the job done. I was also worried about a close shave with the contours! NO issues at ALL! As a buyer I often rely on the reviews of other buyers when making my purchases. So I always try to give my honest, unbiased opinion. If this review was helpful to you please press YES in the link below.
  522. I replaced a 4+ year old Braun 8985 \\"Series 5 Pulsonic 360\\" with the recently released (as of Fall of 2010) model 7-760cc-4. I'm unsure of Braun's confusing numbering -- the \\"dash 4\\" designation that comes after the \\"760cc\\" is printed in such a way on the box that you really have to be looking for it to notice it. If you're not a careful shopper, you may end up with the previous \\"dash 3\\" version with the white base. From the descriptions I've read, there's not a whole lot of difference between the two versions -- expect the same shaving performance -- but again, Braun, why the unclear numbering schemes?<br /><br />As of January 2015, I've been using this shaver practically daily. In that time, it's never been \\"one pass perfect,\\" and actually not as smooth as previous shavers (both electric and razor), but it's close -- and actually, good enough. What's important to me is there are no nicks or cuts, no rash, and no mess. The battery, after all these years (and it's constantly in the charger, unless I'm traveling), remains rock solid. I'm betting the total useful run time is shorter than when it was new, but the battery is storing enough juice that the motor runs strong. I'm not even considering a replacement.<br /><br />Rather than write a bunch more about the performance of this shaver, which is not much different than Braun shavers that came before it, and covered in hundreds of other reviews, I want to point out some of the differences from the previous 8985 and the other Braun shavers of that generation, for those of you considering replacement.<br /><br /> - The shaver itself is much smaller in diameter and easier / more comfortable to grip. This was easily my biggest complaint of the old Braun shavers -- the grip area was similar in cross section to a big bar of soap, and I really noticed it having switched over from a fairly slender & comfortable Panasonic. The hard plastic exterior is now covered in a slightly cushy rubberized covering. The overall ergonomics of the 760cc are imminently more hand-friendly.<br /><br /> - The old slider switch (you know -- On > lock the pivoting head > trimmer pop-up) has been replaced. The new power switch is a glowing on/off push button affair. On either side of the push button are silver + and - buttons to control the shavers speed in three steps. With each change in speed, the power button glows more dimly or brightly. This, I believe, is the 3-stage \\"personalization mode\\" referenced in the product description. A bit bogus, I believe, unless you shave at other than full speed. In fact, their user manual recommends something to the effect of, \\"leave it at the '+' (full speed) position for day to day shaving\\". Regardless, it will turn on in whichever of the three settings you turn it off in.<br /><br /> - Speaking of the pop-up trimmer, the trimmer is now disassociated with the power switch, and pops **out** from the shaver body. Its cutting surface is about half the length of the old one, i.e. very small. I'm trying to get used to it. The old trimmer took some practice to orient correctly while looking in the mirror, but in general, the shaver body itself was kept vertical. I only had to work at getting the shaver level around one axis. This new one -- jeez, it sticks out from the shaver body at a bit of at angle, and the cutting surface is arced a little like a kitchen chef's knife, and so I'm struggling a bit to twist it three different ways to get a straight cut while looking in the mirror. Probably a bit comical to watch, and hopefully I'll grow more accustom to it as the weeks wear on. Trimming cleanly around the ears is suddenly challenging.<br /><br /> - The pivoting head can be locked in place with a slider switch now located on the side of the head.<br /><br /> - The shape of the shaver, in general, is slightly banana contoured. The shaving head itself is canted inward -- not the straight \\"candy bar\\" approach of the older generation. Nice ergonomic change, though subtle.<br /><br /> - The charge indicator is no longer just an LED -- there's now a whole clock dial type affair on the butt end of the shaver (or the top of the shaver when it's docked in the charging base). Moving around the dial, it shows 100/80/60/40/20% charge with a separate LED underneath each number (20% flashes red). Frankly, a bit gimmicky -- especially since it fully charges in an hour. This clock face also has an LED-lit reminder icon to replace the shaving foil & blade, which ought to illuminate every 18 months.<br /><br /> - On the topic of charging, this model uses Li-Ion battery cells vs. Nickel-Hydride in the previous version. Both have a claimed 50 minute run time, and both charged in one hour. And the old model was still running pretty strong after 4 years of continuous use. I think the real improvement here was Li-Ion provides equivalent performance in a smaller, lighter package. I don't know whether the charge is topped off every time it is set in the base, but I've yet to see my battery drop into the 80% range (charge scale is graduated 100% - 80% - 60% etc.). It's hard to be sure, since the charging LEDs go dark after 10 minutes of inactivity.<br /><br /> - The base unit has changed a bit, but it still does the same old thing as before. Same Clean and Renew cartridge refills. Cartridges slide in with a little resistance now, almost as if they're locking in place, but eh, what for? The push-to-clean / push-to-unlock switch of yore has been replaced with a big round \\"start\\" button. This means the shaver is no longer physically latched into the base when cleaning. The graphics are revised (gone are the \\"Eco,\\" \\"Normal\\" and \\"Intensive\\" cleaning cycle indicators, replaced with icons of 1-drop, 2-drops and 3-drops of cleaning solution). There's a \\"check mark\\" graphic that illuminates when the cleaning cycle is complete. Cleaning & heated drying takes 35 to 45 minutes, depending on which cycle is (automatically) selected.<br /><br /> - The cleaning cycle is 1/2 as quiet as the previous model. The pump that circulates the cleaning solution is now pretty close to silent -- no more whiny squeal. But when the shaver switches on it's as loud as it was previously, which was about as loud as the whiny squeal of the circulation pump. So, like I said, half as loud. :)<br /><br /> - An annoyance with the base unit is that it powers down after 10 minutes of inactivity. Walk away from it, and when you return, the only LED illuminated will be the one indicating the fluid level remaining in the Clean and Renew cartridge. Even the illuminated % charge indicator and the \\"check mark\\" LED indicating completion of the cleaning cycle go dark. Why they bothered with a \\"cleaning cycle complete\\" LED is beyond me if it's only going to be lit for 10 minutes following completion of the cycle. One press of the base unit's giant \\"Start\\" button will get everything glowing again.<br /><br /> - The cord still can plug directly into the shaver for travel. The power connector is now a 90° plug that hugs the body of the base unit, no longer sticking straight out as it does on the older models, making it easier to set against the wall on a narrow bathroom shelf. The shaver still comes with a travel case, though it's a zippered / soft shell deal now (in some ways a nice improvement, as long as my shaver doesn't actually switch on while packed in my luggage). The cleaning brush has grown quite dainty -- thimble sized, you might say -- but, to counter that, this new model has better waterproofing so can more easily be rinsed out under the faucet. Although I never had a problem nor hesitation in water rinsing the old one when I took it on the road.<br /><br /> - Most importantly, the 760cc seems to shave about the same as the 8985 it replaced. And in the end, that's what matters. Not quite as close as a razor, but good enough to get me through the day.'s now a whole clock dial type affair on the butt end of the shaver (or the top of the shaver when it's docked in the charging base). Moving around the dial, it shows 100/80/60/40/20% charge with a separate LED underneath each number (20% flashes red). Frankly, a bit gimmicky -- especially since it fully charges in an hour. This clock face also has an LED-lit reminder icon to replace the shaving foil & blade, which ought to illuminate every 18 months. - On the topic of charging, this model uses Li-Ion battery cells vs. Nickel-Hydride in the previous version. Both have a claimed 50 minute run time, and both charged in one hour. And the old model was still running pretty strong after 4 years of continuous use. I think the real improvement here was Li-Ion provides equivalent performance in a smaller, lighter package. I don't know whether the charge is topped off every time it is set in the base, but I've yet to see my battery drop into the 80% range (charge scale is graduated 100% - 80% - 60% etc.). It's hard to be sure, since the charging LEDs go dark after 10 minutes of inactivity. - The base unit has changed a bit, but it still does the same old thing as before. Same Clean and Renew cartridge refills. Cartridges slide in with a little resistance now, almost as if they're locking in place, but eh, what for? The push-to-clean / push-to-unlock switch of yore has been replaced with a big round \\"start\\" button. This means the shaver is no longer physically latched into the base when cleaning. The graphics are revised (gone are the \\"Eco,\\" \\"Normal\\" and \\"Intensive\\" cleaning cycle indicators, replaced with icons of 1-drop, 2-drops and 3-drops of cleaning solution). There's a \\"check mark\\" graphic that illuminates when the cleaning cycle is complete. Cleaning & heated drying takes 35 to 45 minutes, depending on which cycle is (automatically) selected. - The cleaning cycle is 1/2 as quiet as the previous model. The pump that circulates the cleaning solution is nowpretty close to silent -- no more whiny squeal. But when the shaver switches on it's as loud as it was previously, which was about as loud as the whiny squeal of the circulation pump. So, like I said, half as loud. :) - An annoyance with the base unit is that it powers down after 10 minutes of inactivity. Walk away from it, and when you return, the only LED illuminated will be the one indicating the fluid level remaining in the Clean and Renew cartridge. Even the illuminated % charge indicator and the \\"check mark\\" LED indicating completion of the cleaning cycle go dark. Why they bothered with a \\"cleaning cycle complete\\" LED is beyond me if it's only going to be lit for 10 minutes following completion of the cycle. One press of the base unit's giant \\"Start\\" button will get everything glowing again. - The cord still can plug directly into the shaver for travel. The power connector is now a 90° plug that hugs the body of the base unit, no longer sticking straight out as it does on the older models, making it easier to set against the wall on a narrow bathroom shelf. The shaver still comes with a travel case, though it's a zippered / soft shell deal now (in some ways a nice improvement, as long as my shaver doesn't actually switch on while packed in my luggage). The cleaning brush has grown quite dainty -- thimble sized, you might say -- but, to counter that, this new model has better waterproofing so can more easily be rinsed out under the faucet. Although I never had a problem nor hesitation in water rinsing the old one when I took it on the road. - Most importantly, the 760cc seems to shave about the same as the 8985 it replaced. And in the end, that's what matters. Not quite as close as a razor, but good enough to get me through the day.
  523. The 760cc is my 4th Braun shaver. Braun is the still the best electric shaver out there. I take blood thinner medication and I must use an electric shaver. The closenees of the shave keeps getting better with each new model. My wife thinks it's unbelievable that an electic shave can be so close. As to complaints about the high cost, my answer is that you get what you pay for and my Braun is the Mercedes of electric shavers. One should tally up the long term cost of buying razor blades these days and you'll find that the long term cost of a Braun is not as high as you think. When this one wears out, I will buy another one no matter how much it costs. Great engineering and great product!
  524. Easy to clean. This cuts the hair with no tugging or pain. Rarely have I managed to get a skin burn but it tends to only happen on the tip of my upper lip. Sometimes has trouble cutting the hairs on my neck but other brands had the same issue. Must be the angle the hairs comes out is tricky.
  525. Definitely not a close shave as compared to a hand held razor.<br />I'm not sure how it compares to other electric razors since my goal was to replace my hand held razor.
  526. Where has this razor been all my life. No more razor burn and ingrown hairs. This razor shaves closer than a blade (for me) without the irritation and I love the auto cleaner/lubricator base. Best razor I've every use, worth the 200 bucks. Only had it a month so can't rate it's durability yet but seems to be well constructed. I find the expense of the replacement cleaner cartridges very reasonable in a multi pack and the replacable foil bladehead is claimed to last 18 months.
  527. I haven't shave with an electric shaver for a very long time. It was time to get back to being clean shave. Long ago I had the 3 head crappy type, it didn't work very well. For the past 25 years I've used throw aways and not shaving every day looking like Don Johnson, like I aways had a 5 o'clock shadow.   529. When my old Remington shaver broke down, I tried a rotary shaver rather than another foil shaver. My choice to try was the Norelco PT730 which had good reviews however I found it just made my skin way too red, especially so around the neck area.<br /><br />After a month of trying to adapt to that shaver, I gave up and moved onto this Braun 7 series and I gotta say, it is the best foil shaver I've ever used. The shaver is light and compact but built well and I feel it will easily last for years without any issues. The ability to dock AND clean it is a huge plus, but be aware that these cleaning cycles may take anywhere from 32 to 43 minutes, (According to the manual) however the unit does become much cleaner than using just the included tiny brush.<br /><br />You get the docking back to recharge and wash the shaver but the coil cord can be plugged directly into the shaver as well for those who are on the road or have limited counter space.<br /><br />Overall, I have not been able to find a single complaint for this great shaver. It's well worth the price!<br /><br />Edit:<br />I went to register this product and after much fighting of the website to get to the bottom of the page, they asked for the TESA code on the shaver...which I looked real well and could not find one.<br />Braun support emailed me back stating \\"We've simplified the process and it's no longer necessary to register your Braun shaver online. Please hold on to the original sales receipt in order to ensure warranty coverage.\\"<br /><br />Strange way of doing things...but ok...no issues yet.
  530. ...there are a couple of glitches. First, the slide to get the head off-set to shave tight corners (like under and around the nose) was difficult to make work initially, and now has failed completely. Secondly, I have followed the on line writers who suggested using rubbing alcohol vs. their expensive fluid. It works, and is nowhere near the cost. Overall, it's the best shave I've ever had. I'm 75 and have an old guy's beard, so that's saying a lot for this razor!

  566. This is the best electric shaver I've ever used, and I've been using them for decades. I've had this shaver for over 8 months, and have had a great experience with it. The Clean and Renew system is excellent, too. I have tried all the top shavers, including Norelco 3D (1250X) and Panasonic Arc 4 (LA63-S and ES LF 51A), and for my face, the Bruan beats them hands-down. I get a close, comfortable shave every time. It is louder than the Norelco, but not as loud as the Panasonic. I was hesitant about the Clean and Renew system, as I thought it might just be a gimmick, but it works very well (though it's fairly noisy in the first part of the cleaning process), and leaves the shaver with a pleasant smell - just a bonus. I was bothered that there was no plastic cover for the foil when I got the shaver, but the protective carrying case is all you need. I traveled to three countries in Europe for three weeks recently, and I only needed to charge the shaver once a week or so, and the protective case worked perfectly. I highly recommend this shaver and cleaning system.

  569. I purchased this to replace a Panasonic Arc electric shaver that would no longer charge. I must say that I'm extremely disappointed in the quality of the shave that this one provides. While preparing to attend a wedding, I used this shaver beforehand. Despite spending almost 20 minutes shaving in every possible direction and repeating the process an endless number of times, this shaver left my skin with noticeable stubble. It simply doesn't give me a close shave.<br /><br />Based on the mostly positive reviews, it would seem that this shaver works well for most people. Unfortunately, I'm not one of them. My only reason for purchasing this instead of a new Panasonic shaver, was because the Panasonic shaver cleaning system is poorly designed. From experience with my old shaver, the Panasonic cleaning system seems to be designed for failure. During the course of the 8 years that I owned it, I had to replace the cleaning device 4 times.<br /><br />With that said, at least as far as I'm concerned, despite the lousy cleaning system, the Panasonic shaver delivers a much closer shave than this one does. Granted, there's nothing as close as a manual blade shave, but it would seem that in this day and age, someone would offer an electric shaver that is truly great. The Panasonic was good, not great. This one by comparison is lousy. One final note, the Braun customer service department is among the worst that I've ever dealt with. Since being bought out by Proctor and Gamble, Braun customer service has deteriorated to a level that renders it all but useless should you need to utilize it.
  570. This is the second electric Braun shaver I've owned and have turned other people onto them. They seem to be hands down one of the best electric shaver systems on the market and have had nothing, but praises to sing about them. The cleaning that is done makes the blade feel fresh after every shave.<br /><br />The only catch is you do want to make sure you still replace the blade as recommended. I've had a few instances where people who were turned onto the shaving system hadn't replaced the blade in over a year and was starting to complain about the system. When replaced it was back to the performance it had when new.<br /><br />The cleaning system can cause a false sense of blade renewal since the blade deterioration occurs over a long period of time.

  579. This shaver does an barely adequate job [not great] if you shave every day. I find, however, that if I skip a day it will pull somewhat at the next day's longer growth. It's also a necessity to use the cleaning system after every use or the shaver will pull at my whiskers. It's a high maintenance device and of course you have to keep buying the cleaning cartridges. They seem to last about a month. And now, after less than 9 months use, the shaver no longer fits smoothly into the \\"clean & Renew Station\\", which is the large receptacle that houses the shaver and cleaning cartridge during cleaning. It's plastic and apparently not durable so that now I have to fiddle with the thing when inserting the shaver and even when it seems I've gotten the shaver to fit the contacts properly it sometimes starts and then \\"unfits\\" and turns off. This thing is also big and takes up a lot of counter space. The trimmer on the shaver is virtually useless, warranting a zero rating if possible. I vacillated between giving this shaver a 1 or 2 star rating. Suffice it to say I would not buy it again and do not recommend it to anyone else. Addendum 9/25/12: Forgot to mention that when you are able to finally turn on the clean & renew station it makes a loud and very annoying intermittent noise for several minutes, a noise that sounds like a loud, unpleasant fog horn with a sore throat and a bad attitude [yes I know that I'm mixing metaphors here but that's how it sounds to me]. Update 12/5/12: The shaver is now beginning to fall apart. There are two buttons that release & lock the head. The other day when I placed the shaver on the counter the \\"lock\\" button just fell out. I didn't bang it or drop it or jolt it in any way. It just fell out and there's no getting it back in properly. It just won't seat right. Folks, buy a shaver that's less complicated and with fewer complex mechanisms.
  580. I've had this shaver for 2 years now and have replaced the head twice so far and it still works like a champ. I am in the military and shave every day and this does the job.   581. I switched to electric shavers about 15 years ago. My face was too sensitive for the blade shaving. I got the Norelco and it did fine for ten years.   582. My wife loves the results. That's all you really need to know, isn't it?<br /><br />This is easily the best shaver I've ever owned. It's super-easy to use and the results are indistinguishable from a traditional safety blade shave. The battery lasts a couple weeks before it needs recharged, but I drop in the charging station once per week just to keep it topped off. I suspect the cleaning station doesn't really \\"sense\\" anything, but rather just makes an assumption about how dirty your shaver is by recording how long it's been turned on since its last known cleaning. I have the station clean it once per week while it's charging and that's enough for me. The cleaning does an excellent job and with the solution provided in the original package the razor comes out smelling quite nice too.<br /><br />Before I bought this I read quite a few reviews about it being noisy. Unless you're trying to stealth shave without anyone knowing the noise really isn't an issue. The little noise it does make is well within reasonable expectations and even shaving next to my ear doesn't make me believe otherwise. This noise is a complete non-issue and has been way overblown in other reviews.<br /><br />If you need a good shaver you won't regret buying this one.

  596. Braun razors are pretty good. For the price, I'm not a huge fan. But the shave quality is well above average. I rarely find anyone who really loves the new ones -- most of us loved our old [insert 20 yr old shaver model here -- mine is 8500] and keep paying high prices to Braun hoping to recover that nostalgia. Most of us are on our 3rd try and that's annoying -- not so much because its expensive, but because we keep getting really good, but 'not quite there'.<br /><br />But, if you've read all the glowing positive reviews and are ready to jump in...Don't buy this one! First, look for the 790 and see if its cheaper.<br /><br />Because of so much positive press, the 760 is in high demand and actually sells for more than the higher model 790. These razors are essentially identical. The only difference is the 790 has a 'Fast Clean' option. Not a big deal but if you can get more for less, why not?<br /><br />PS: I recommend the Panasonic Arc4. Cheaper, and to my mind/beard, a bit better shave. Doesn't give you the feel and experience of the Braun which some guys really value. But 'better shave including wet/dry for less' works for me.<br /><br />PPS: If you're buying this as a gift, get the Braun. Panasonic still makes everything with that lightweight, cheap feel.
  597. Requires effort to get a really close shave.
  598. I purchased this as a gift for my hubby about 3 years ago. As long as you keep it clean and the head changed regularly, it is a great, smooth and close shave with no irritation. I even use it on my lady legs because My sensitive skin gets irritated and ingrown from razors. Ours came with a hard travel case which is great for all the traveling we do. The charger can be used on the shaver separate from the base (which is good because of our following comments).<br /><br />Negatives:<br />Base wore out fast. within a year the contacts had faulted and would not get a good connection for charging or cleaning.<br />the pop-out shaver springs also broke within a year causing us to have to hold it shut or open while shaving.<br />Cleaning is time consuming. the \\"clean\\" function and solution should be labeled \\"disinfecting\\" because it seems to make the hairs even more powdery and sticky causing a terrible accumulation in the base machine and shaver head. We find that removing the head after each shave and thoroughly rinsing the head and shaver before the \\"clean\\" function keeps it all cleaner and caused the head to last longer (is a plus since they are so expensive).<br /><br />UPDATE:<br />it is about 5 years old now - still shaving great - hubby travels for business and takes this along inthe hard travel case with the wall plug adapter and it is still a good unit. Threw the base away a long time ago. the wall plug charges just fine and its is easy to clean by hand.
  599. I have used this razor for about 2 weeks. Its the best razor I have ever owned. Its the closest shave I have had from an electric. It very close to a razor shave, very very close. I guess the only thing missing is the razor burn. I have difficult hairs on the side/front of my neck that electrics have always had trouble shaving all of them. This razor gets them with out any trouble. Cleaning is automatic and I really like that feature. This is the smartest purchase I have made all year.
  600. I replaced an old but working Braun razor that had parts (plastic)falling off of it. The new razor is great; the shave is quicker and closer; the cleaning/recharging system is simple. I often travel for weeks at a time. I wish Braun had a travel cleaning system instead of the usual brush and apply a few drops of oil.
  601. Finally had to replace my old Braun 7540 that had served me well for some 10 + years and thought I had the best shaver ever. With the new 760, I didn't know what I was missing. I read some of the complaints and reviews before I bought this and I really don't know why anyone had any problems unless they had purchased a lemon, in which case I hope they got a replacement ! The 760 is quiet, shaves closer than I could have expected, totally smooth with no irritation and the battery still shows 100% charge after three weeks of use !<br />Having had a Braun before, I am OK with the cleaning process and having to buy the solution. Like others have said, you just don't have to clean it everyday.<br />So buy this shaver (or any OTHER Braun) . . . you can't go wrong !
  602. I have been using the top of the line Norelco for years, and started reading shaver reviews when it was time for a new head. This Braun got top reviews, so I decided to try it. The best news is that it delivers a really close shave. I won't make any comparisons to blade shaving because I haven't used blades in years -- too many nicks and cuts-- but the shave is really close. The shaver doesn't seem to go back and forth like an old remington, as much as vibrate -- really really fast. I think that must be the secret to the system. Cleaning is very easy: You can either use the charging/cleaning base or just turn it on and run it under hot water. The charging/cleaning base is easiest (just drop it in and push a button), but there are a couple of negatives to that approach. First, the fluid, which is an alcohol/lubricant, has a strange odor which I don't love. Not a big deal, but that close to your nose, I could do without it. Second, the fluid is a consumable which needs to be changed about every four weeks. The stuff isn't that cheap. I have resorted to a combination of running it under water and using the base every other shave. It's a good compromise for me. On the road, I like the fact that the shaver will hold its charge for at least a week, if not longer. I don't need to drag the base or the cord around with me. The travel case is nice and small, an advantage when packing light. While this shaver is pricey, my philosophy has always been to spend the most on stuff you use the most. Shaving certainly qualifies. I would have given 5 stars, but the cleaning/lube fluid seems like a bit of a gimick and way to generate an ongoing revenue stream for Braun. In any event, I do recommend this product wholeheartedly.
  603. Bought the Braun Series 7-760cc shaver system in May. By the end of October the cleaning/charging station failed to recharge the razor.This was an expensive electric razor that does not work and they will not replace the broken parts! I will never buy Braun again and advise people to not buy their products. I was lured to buy this defective razor system by Amazon's ad that said this was the most popular shaver.

  606. It seemed pricey, yet it had high marks from Consumer Reports. I was amazed. The best electric shave I've ever had. The blades last 18 months. I'm not sure how long the rinse bath cartridge last, I assume several months. Haven't use up the original, yet.
  607. Have used this product for two weeks, and find it meets Braun claims in every respect. It is very quiet compared to any other shavers I have owned, it is slick looking, it shaves as close as any other shaver I have had, but not as \\"close as a blade\\". The cleaning system probably costs Braun as much to produce as the shaver, and it must be responsible for the high price of the combination. But, it does work through the cleaning, drying, lubricating, charging routine without faltering.

  613. I have always had a braun shaver. Cut close, never a rash, self cleaning, off charge will last almost a week
  614. I've been using a Philips Norelco for over 11 years and decided it was time to buy a new shaver when the original Ni-Cad batteries didn't hold a charge any more. I was very satisfied with the Philips, especially considering how long it lasted, but wanted to give Braun's automatic cleaning system a try. I was worried about how often I'd need to replace the cleaning cartridge, but I've been using the Braun for three months now, every other day with auto cleaning, and the cartridge still hasn't run out. The automated cleaning works great and is hassle free. Now, I can just use the shaver and let the &#34;dock&#34; do all the cleaning and charging. The shaver itself works about as good as Norelco's radial system, but in my opinion, is a bit easier to use in the neck area. The build quality of the shaver is good, too. The &#34;dock&#34; is a bit too plastic and &#34;hollow&#34;, but overall I'm very satisfied.
  615. Very pleased with the Braun electric shaver. It really does do a great job and, if I take my time, it is as good as my Gillette blade shaver.   616. I've been using this shaver for two months now and am very happy with it. It seemed to be overpriced but with it being on sale at the time and comparing to other shavers on the market I went ahead and purchased. I have used Braun shavers for many years and and have been satisfied with most of them. This is by far the best (and most expensive) shaver I have ever used.<br />I have been using the cleaning system every other day with great results. The cleaning fluid is still half full after the two months -- looks like I will get three months of cleaning on each CCR refill.<br /><br />The product description states this was made in Germany. This is true to a point. The package I received contained the shaver made in Germany, the cleaning system unit made in Hungary, the power cord/charger made in China, and the CCR cartridge made in Ireland. All appear to be well made and work well.

  618. Wonderful razor. My husband loves it.
  619. I got it for my best friend and he loves it.........the best product on the market ......it does the job better than all other machines........highly recommended for a nice gift.
  620. I spent a couple hundred bucks on the shaver a few years back, thinking it was gonna give me an awesome close shave with all kinds of other bonus features with it to make my morning life easier. Well, the only part of my face it did a good job at was the cheeks and the chin. It felt great on those areas, so good I kept sliding my hand over my cheeks and chin to feel the smoothness and there was no irritation. K, on to the rest of the shave.... Every other part (jawline, neck) this razor was not good AT ALL. No matter how many different angles or passes I used it would not cut all the hair on my neck and even though it was just short or stubble hair the shaver acted more of like a hair clipper in that area leaving plenty of whisker or the same stubble that was there at the beginning. I had to use an old braun razor to shave my neck after shaving my cheeks/chin with the new one and trying like crazy but failing to get the neck done.<br /><br />My old razor was a braun 6520, which imo had a better cutting blade (believe it or not) and the foil was way better designed to contour and reach/cut hair on all areas of my face and neck. The motor wasn't as strong as this new one but for the reasons I just stated it got the job done, after a few passes. So basically I can give this newer razor an A for having a strong motor but a D for its overrated, overhyped blade cutting technology and design. I don't recommend it at all unless you oddly only have to shave your cheeks, chin, and moustache and don't grow much neck stubble.... and have a ton of money to waste on the razor. Oh and the trimmer on this razor pops out at a side angle and is not wide enough like the older braun model shavers that popped straight up and were twice as wide making them more effective.<br /><br />All the other features this razor has are gimmicky like the special cleaning system and LED lights and all that crap, not worth spending more than $5-10 on those kind of extras imo, its the shaving technology that counts, and in this case, braun has a long way to go to get back on track. I'm hoping they get it right next time, they must have used some guy with peach fuzz on his cheeks and no neck hair to test this product out on while developing it. Go back to the 6000 series blades, trimmer, and foil design braun, only add a stronger motor! There is a reason why the 6000 braun series shavers are still selling like hotcakes on ebay used or new for $100-200 today 8 years after you foolishly decided to stop producing them! Its because unlike this new one, they were designed correctly to get an entire shave done!

  657. I have been using a few different Norelco electric shavers for the past 15 years, which seem to last me about 7 or so years before I replace them. I have had my current one for about 5 years and it was in need of a new shaving head. Unfortunately Norelco had changed the way they make their new heads and the quality is not nearly as good as before and with that said, I decided to give the Braun a try...<br /><br />Simply put, I wish I would have changed a long time ago. It shaves much closer than my Norelco ever did, it does not require going over the same spot over and over to get those stubborn hairs, it shaves faster, and it is easier to shave (up & down motion instead of small circles). I much prefer the blade head of the Braun over the Norelco for those reasons.<br /><br />Pro's: Better shave, faster shave, 3 setting control leaves the neck area with no red irradiation ever, cleaning and charging station work very well.<br />Con's: Bigger shaver in the hand, (Noreclo feels better to hold), louder than the Norelco, sounds more like trimmers<br /><br />Overall, I am very happy with this Braun Series 7 shaver. I just hope it lasts as long as my Norelco's did, and hope they don't change their blade quality.

  670. I thought the product seemed very well made (the shaver itself, maybe not the cleaning device) and I can see why people rave about it, but it's just not for me. I'm a guy that has always used razors and thought maybe this would be a faster and easier way to shave. Unfortunately it isn't as fast as using a razor for me and definitely isn't as close. I will say that I have a good amount of scarring on my chin and an electric razor is nice for going over things like that and not having to worry about nicking myself. I also found that i was able to get a close shave in those areas where I'm usually hesitant to make more than a few passes with a traditional razor. I just found that the jawline and neck we too difficult to get a good shave and by the time that I tried every direction my neck was red. I'm not sure if it's coincidence but my jawline broke out a few days later.<br /><br />With all that being said I'm just saying that for me it wasn't a good fit, but It is a well made product and if you give it the time i'm sure it could be a good product for you. I'm a traditional razor guy and thought I could transition but i think i'll stick to what I know.
  671. I would recommend this razor without hesitation. It does a good job on my moderately heavy beard, without the frequent irritation that I got with a blade.<br /><br />PROS:<br />* Good ergonomics. The plastic does not feel cheap, and it fits my hand well.<br />* Rugged. My unit has survived an inadvertent drop test without a scratch.<br />* Inexpensive to use. I was originally concerned that the refill cartridges would be an achille's heel of this unit, but each cartridge lasts for months. I run the &#34;clean&#34; function about twice a week.<br />* Sips power. I just got back from a month of travel, during which I used the razor nearly every day. I did not charge it, and I only cleaned it by removing the head and tapping out loose hairs / hair dust. It reports the charge level is at about 50% now, and it's running perfectly. I'll never bother bringing the power cord on trips again.<br /><br />CONS:<br />* Hard to think of any. The OCD part of my brain wishes the razor stuck straight up in its cradle, rather than at a 15 degree angle? Seriously, this is a great unit.

  673. I chose a Braun electric razor since I have used them exclusively for many years and have been very satisfied with the quality of shave from them. While that was a great improvement the cost per month was quite high.<br /><br />Since I have the Braun 760cc I can simply use a cheap readily available aftershave. Now, provided this shaver lasts a while (I think it will as it seems like a high quality shaver), it should easily pay off.<br /><br />And to top it off there's even less irritation using this shaver then what I had using single blade razors.<br /><br />I occassionally will still use a single bladed razor to touch up a few stubborn, hard to get hairs but I still consider it a great shave.<br /><br />For the first week or two I used it I did have a slight irritation reaction but once I got over the \\"break-in period\\", and learned to not apply too much pressure the irritation virtually dissappeared....something I can't say of previous shavers and razors.<br /><br />So, All in all I'm very happy and would recommend it to anyone.

My 8995 also had an LCD display; only the more expensive model has that feature. These are minor issues, but it is a shame that only the most expensive current model has the same features as the model I purchased in 2006; otherwise this gets 5 stars.   699. The only reason I am not giving the 4 star rating is the cleaning system. greedy Braun wants us to spend money on all the cleaning pods. When mine gets low, I just top it off with 91% rubbing alcohol solution, and it will keep going for a few more uses until it fills up with hair. Another thing you can do to reduce hair build up is wet your face, then apply shaving cream as if using a straight razor, then wet braun blade and shave with this shaver like normal, when your done remove blade and rinse off, then put back into holder and clean like normal, it will keep it sharp and clean and reduce hair buildup in cleaner system, and your face has the benefit of using shaving cream which reduces razor burn and bumps

  725. I had the Braun Series 5 which lasted me several years, so when the switch failed I looked for a good deal on the same brand. This Series 7 does a good job of shaving but I gave it only 4 of 5 stars for two reasons. 1) if you are shaving with a mustache, the hairs seem to get caught in the sides of the blades and it pulls on them. Ouch! 2) the trimmer opens up like a door in front of the shaver, and if you are looking in a mirror, it blocks the view of exactly what you are shaving. You have to move to one side to peek in to assure you are shaving the right areas. Once you get used to it, it is ok but still slightly annoying.<br />The older shaver had the trimmer close in to the shaver so there was no blockage in a mirror. They probably lost the engineer who designed the Series 5 and made the argument to keep the trimmer close to the shaver. So when the re-designed the Series 7, they made an old mistake. Otherwise, I am very satisfied with the shave.

I almost didn't buy this because I didn't think it included this feature. As it turns out its a very effective.<br /><br />I also like the variable speed of this razor. When I'm shaving more sensitive areas like my neck I slow down the blade to avoid razor burn.<br /><br />I took off one star because of the cost of the consumables, specifically the cleaning solvent. I mean I like the razor after its been cleaned and I think it's a clever way to clean the blade with minimal hassle. Unfortunately you have to buy the refills from Braun and they aren't exactly cheap. Since part of the solvent is an alcohol it evaporates even if you're not using it. I've started cleaning it about once every 9-14 days. That's about how often I have to charge the razor so I clean the razor at the same time. I also keep the cap for the cleaning solvent so when I'm done cleaning it I cap it and put it back on the shelf. With this approach the solvent lasts for almost a year.

This is my first premium razor and it gets 2 thumbs up.
  760. After years of using a Remington Shaver, I decided to switch when Remington opted to discontinue the line I enjoyed. This Braun 760 is much the same only quieter, takes longer to shave and certainly different to clean. I'm not sold on the emersion method of cleaning so I still tap and brush it clean. Travelling is more difficult with that emersion tank and parts and maintenance are not as accessible. I'm early on the learning curve so will try it for a while longer to see how I can improve the results.
  761. Expensive razor, but well worth the price. The Braun series 7 is especially effective in the hard to shave areas- around the neck and under the chin. Of course the expense will be on-going with the necessary purchase of the proprietary refill cleaning cartridges which if used to clean the razor everyday, last a month. I suggest cleaning after two days of use and thus doubling the cartridge time. The noise of the cleaning doesn't bother me counter to what others have written. The trimmer is a very nice effective addition.
  762. Bought this for my husband as a birthday gift and he loves it! Unfortunately you have to walk around with a slightly imperfect shave for a week or two. Once that period has past, it works really well. Closest I've ever gotten to a manual razor with an electronic razor. The self cleaning charger works really well too, but takes a lot of time (like half an hour). Overall, I would recommend this product but if you're impatient or self conscious about waiting for your beard to grow in the right way, I would say stick to a manual razor.

  788. This is my first electric shaver and I couldn't be more pleased with the results. I was considering buying an electric shaver for a while since I have to shave everyday and was tired of all the mess and razor burns I got using manual blades. I googled around a bit to know the pros and cons of foil and rotary blades and decided that the former suits me best. Again, as my first electric shaver, it was a shot in the dark, but it certainly hit the bullseye.<br />The shaver itself feels very well built. Its head and foil cutters are really flexible, adjusting comfortably to the contours of your face. You can lock the shaving head to any position that makes it easier to shave hard to reach areas. The cleaning station looks a bit flimsy, but it serves its purpose and works really well.<br />Shaving with the Braun Series 7-760cc was a pleasant surprise. I got the same result than using a traditional blade - minus the mess and razor burns - in much less time, I kid you not! Seriously, believe it when they say it's a really close shave. I was so impressed that I spent all day after my first shave feeling how smooth my skin was (and obviously getting funny looks from people around me). Of course, don't expect it to shave a week of beard growth and have stunning results. As I said, I have to shave everyday and my beard grows rather quickly and is quite thick. For me, this shaver works like a charm!<br />The Clean & Renew system does its job as well. The station analyses how dirty the shaver is and which cleaning cycle is recommended. The cleaning process only starts if you press the button; that way you can decide whether to clean it immediately after shaving or let the shaver get a bit dirtier before pulling the trigger. Either way, all three cycles clean the shaver head throughly. It also dries and lubricates the foil cutters. It does take a bit of time to clean the cassette, that's true, but you don't have to stay around watching while it does its thing. Once you're done shaving, simply leave the handheld shaver in the station and let the magic begin. I myself prefer to rinse the shaving head under hot tap water after every shave and use the Clean & Renew system only once a week, making the cartridges last longer.<br />One last thing: I was considering buying either the 7-760cc or the 7-790cc. Googling around I found they are practically the same, the latter having a 'quick clean' function and other bells and whistles. I suggest you to go with this one, the 7-760cc, which is cheaper. You could use the extra bucks to buy some Clean & Renew cartridges.<br /><br />To sum it all up, I really recommend this shaver. It was a spot on choice for daily shaving, achieving impressive results and really close shaves with no razor burns (I cannot emphasise this enough)!ving, simply leave the handheld shaver in the station and let the magic begin. I myself prefer to rinse the shaving head under hot tap water after every shave and use the Clean & Renew system only once a week, making the cartridges last longer.<br />One last thing: I was considering buying either the 7-760cc or the 7-790cc. Googling around I found they are practically the same, the latter having a 'quick clean' function and other bells and whistles. I suggest you to go with this one, the 7-760cc, which is cheaper. You could use the extra bucks to buy some Clean & Renew cartridges.<br /><br />To sum it all up, I really recommend this shaver. It was a spot on choice for daily shaving, achieving impressive results and really close shaves with no razor burns (I cannot emphasise this enough)!

  790. Let me just state this right up front: I hate shaving. I despise it more than any other chore. Or at least that's how I felt until 3 days ago when I got my hands on this thing. In a nutshell, this has already changed my life. For more than 20 years, I've dreaded shaving because it has taken up 30 minutes of my morning routine and has left my face practically raw and bloody. I never knew shaving didn't HAVE to be such a monumental pain. Turns out I had just been using the wrong shaver all my adult life.<br /><br />My previous 2 shavers were Braun 1-series devices, and both were utterly useless. They did nothing but destroy my face. My routine had evolved to a dry electric shave followed up by a wet razor shave to get all the hairs that the electric left behind. When my last Braun 1 series died, I ordered the 760cc (not from Amazon) thinking \\"what the hell... let's see if spending more gets any better results.\\" I had very low expectations, based on my previous experience with the cheaper shavers.<br />I got the package on Saturday, and waited until Monday to grow a decent beard for the first trial. Man alive, was I surprised when I turned the 760cc on. It OBLITERATED my beard with absolutely zero irritation. Whereas my old 1 series used to take 5 passes to even put a dent in my beard, this thing just plowed right through with no problems whatsoever. I just could not believe it would be this good. Normally, I shave as infrequently as I possibly can, but this week I had some work obligations which required me to shave on consecutive days. That was the ultimate test for me. I figured it's one thing if this shaver can give a smooth shave on a 3-day-old beard where it has something to hold on to and cut, but I fully expected that it would just irritate my skin with a 1-day-old stubble. Again: Wrong. I'm sitting here right now basking in the glory of a freshly-shaven face and skin that's not actually on fire like it normally is.<br /><br />Compared to myjunky old 1 series shavers, this thing is built like a tank. That means it's MUCH heavier and a little less comfortable to hold for long periods, but I guess it needs to have a higher capacity (and heavier) battery to drive the more powerful motor. I haven't had the chance to use the self-clean cycle, so I can't comment on its effectiveness yet.<br /><br />I'm giving this shaver 4 stars instead of 5 because of one major annoyance. When I first plugged it in, the lights on the base cycled for a few seconds, and never came back on. I unplugged it and plugged it back in a couple of times and made sure the cord was connected to the base securely, but no dice. It appeared to have just died within moments of coming out of the box for the first time. Fortunately, I still had the cord to my old 1 series, and fortunately, the plug was the same shape and size to fit into the base. I plugged in the old cord and everything worked fine after that. There was some sort of defect with the cord that shipped with this thing. If I hadn't had my old one, I would have been majorly ticked off.<br /><br />Admittedly, I've only had this shaver for a few days, and a lot can go wrong. I'll keep this review up to date if my impression changes over time.

  801. Definitely the best shaver I've had in forty years. The first ones I tried all those decades ago was also a Braun, but I soon switched to Panasonic because their batteries lasted twice as long as Braun's (both in terms of shaves per charge and lifetime charges.) But Braun has caught back up and their shaving technology is unrivaled now. What I really like about this unit is that the springs for the cutters are all inside the detachable foil assembly, so in the unlikely event they ever go south, they can be replaced with a new unit. Every part seems extremely well machined in the Series 7, I've had mine for over half a year now and the whole thing still looks brand new inside and out; works as well as on the day that I got it.<br /><br />Was skeptical at first at the need for the mammoth charging/cleaning unit, figuring I could maintain the shaver head fine myself just by running it under hot water. Ha! Can't fool the Braun; no matter how good a job I think I've done washing out the shaver head myself, it instantly detects whatever trace of whisker might be left behind and selects the appropriate cleaning cycle.<br /><br />Only issue was some confusion from the instructions that come with this unit, which seem to suggest that the shaver can only be used dry — says not even to wash your face before using. This struck me as odd, as this model is clearly advertised as waterproof. But I've had no problems shaving with my stubble wet down with a bit of isopropyl. Much easier to shave that way, otherwise the foils can drag a bit over my skin, especially in high humidity. As the cleansing unit supplied with the kit is alcohol based, no fear of damaging the shaver this way.<br /><br />As some others have mentioned, the Series 7 comes with a travel pouch that is only large enough to hold the shaver, and not the cord. While I do get a lot of shaves from a single charge, I still wouldn't dream of traveling for any length of time with no way to recharge the device. Kinda trivial a complaint, and obviously no deal breaker.<br /><br />For overall quality, this shaving kit rules. So glad I switched back to Braun, the Pulsonic feels built to last.ivial a complaint, and obviously no deal breaker.<br /><br />For overall quality, this shaving kit rules. So glad I switched back to Braun, the Pulsonic feels built to last.

I really notice an easier, better shave after it has gone through the clean cycle. It really works! Purchased the cleaning solution modules in four-pack from Amazon and have gone through one four pack in two years.   813. Love the razor! I gave it a few weeks for my skin to adjust to the different razor type. I wasn't that impressed at first, but now it's definitely a time-saver in the morning.<br /><br />I had a Philips Norelco 8150XL before this, and it would actually shave a bit closer. I would never go back to that thing though...if there were ever a few longer hairs it would catch on them and pull (not a good thing if you have a goatee and want to get a close shave around it or if youre like me and don't like to shave on weekends).<br /><br />Anyways...back to the Braun. Still gives me a nice close shave, and probably better that it doesn't shave quite as close as my old Norelco because I don't get any ingrown hairs now (and it doesn't pull if I run into longer hair). Plus the built-in trimmer is 1000x better than on the old Norelco. It has a bit of a curve to it, so that's nice for trimming tight areas.<br /><br />I love the fact that it has a Lithium-Ion battery and says that it doesn't cause any 'battery memory' issues if you recharge before it's drained. That was the main reason why I chose this model over the 3 or 5 series.<br /><br />The Clean & Renew wash system is very nice. I do notice that I get a better shave on the mornings after it has ran the cleaning cycle. Just feels like it runs a little smoother and I don't have to go over areas again. Not sure how expensive it'll end up being to replace those, but I've had the system for about a month now and the indicator still reads as full. The book says you should clean it after every shave, and at that rate a cartridge should last 1-2 months. I run the cleaning cycle maybe every 2-6 days instead and I would imagine it will last me 3-4 months.<br /><br />Having the 3 different intensity settings seemed nice at first, but once I tried all 3 I just leave it on the highest speed...cuts quicker and plows through thick stubble like nobody's business. I guess this could be useful for somebody with more sensitive skin or thinner facial hair, but since my skin is pretty tough and my hair is course I just leave it on high all the time.<br /><br />Looks great on the counter top. Almost like a piece of art how it sits offset in the base (which is a great design by the way. I wasn't sure why they did that at first, but it's so the cleaning solution can be gravity fed through the blades as it's being cleaned).<br /><br />The only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 was because it doesn't cut quite as close, and the cleaning solution could make it costly to maintain if you clean it daily. I would definitely recommend the shaver though, it feels solid and I expect it'll last for quite a while.

  816. This product was a gift and it received high praise for delivering what it said it would do. Have spoken with others who have one and they say the same.
  817. I have used Braun shavers for what seems like forever. My last shaver was the then-top-of-the-line 7680, which served me well for close to ten years (the battery doesn't hold its charge the way it used to). When I decided to replace it, I eventually decided that while the differences seem small, if a product is going to serve me for so many years I might as well get the best option, and the price difference is not significant when averaged over a 5+ year period.<br />When researching this category, I was looking for the water-washable models. Choosing them can significantly reduce your reliance on the (more expensive) original cleaning solution, and make the total cost lower than cheaper models. I was skeptical about the \\"Pulsonic\\" part of the system (the \\"microvibrations\\" supposed to improve shaving efficiency), but the given the models that I had available to choose from, the 760 was the most logical choice.<br /><br />When I received the shaver, I was actually surprised to find that the shaving experience and results are considerably better than my older shaver (even with a new head and full power). Shaving time is down to almost half what it was, even after I miss a day of shaving. Whether this is thanks to the Pulsonic feature or not, I cannot say (as I haven't had a chance to try a Series 5 shaver). The ability to choose shaving \\"strength\\" is nice, but for me it's not a must. I certainly feel the difference in the more sensitive ares (mustache area, mainly), but probably not enough to make a point of pushing the button before and after I get to those areas. The buttons are not easy enough to find by feel, and shaving is a little slower in the \\"gentle\\" setting, so I'm not sure about this trade-off. The water-washable feature was all I asked for: pop up the screen, run the shaver under water for a couple of seconds, and you're done. I will not be able to go back, and it looks like I will only use the cleaner function once a month, or perhaps even less frequently(tip: if you choose to go that route, you really need to keep the cleaning solution container closed with its original cap when not in use, as it will evaporate completely after a few weeks if left open in the cleaner).<br /><br />A few weeks after I got the shaver, it fell on the bathroom counter from a higher shelf, and stopped working right (making louder noises and not shaving well). Since I bought it in the US, but used it abroad, I didn't have any documentation save for the Amazon receipt (printed from the website). The local Braun lab took it in, determined there was a broken part that needs to be replaced, and did it under warranty (it looks like they practically replaced the entire \\"head\\"). While it took a few days longer than I expected to get the part to the lab (holiday season and all), I was really happy with the service, and very happy with the end result. Doing a relatively big replacement under warranty with \\"skimpy\\" evidence and no original documentation deserves special praise in this day and age.<br /><br />Overall positives:<br />- Water washable.<br />- Excellent shaving experience.<br />- Excellent service.<br />- Quality feel and build.<br /><br />Overall negatives:<br />- Shaving \\"strength\\" buttons not easily findable by touch (yes, I'm nitpicking here).<br />- Higher priced than some competitors.<br /><br />I definitely recommend this model, or any equivalent model with the water-washable feature.
  818. I really wanted to like this shaver, but it's simply inferior to past Braun offerings. I have had this razor for approximately 2 months.<br /><br />To give you a frame of reference, my old razor is a 8 year old Braun 8985.<br /><br />SHAVE QUALITY:<br /><br />First things first, if your facial hair is longer than 1 or 2 days growth, this thing WILL be painful and pull hair. It's worse than a kinky girlfriend. It seems like to avoid the hair pulling, you MUST shave with it daily. Do not skip days or you will feel its wrath. This would be mitigated some if the trimmer feature actually worked, but it doesn't (see below). That said, the shave it offers it fairly decent. It gives a pretty close shave (not manual razor quality, obviously, but good for an electric). It does occasionally skip a hair or two, particularly on the neck.<br /><br />This is the kicker. It shaves ABOUT as well as my 8 year old Braun 8985. I have NEVER replaced the head on that razor, not even once. I also haven't had the cleaning base for it for about 5 years. I feel like a brand new nearly top of the line electric should fair better than my old model that's never been changed and rarely cleaned. Sadly, this is not the case.<br /><br />Also, don't expect to actually be able to use the trimmer feature. Not only is it like an inch wide, but it also does absolutely nothing, literally. I'm pretty sure it's just programmed to make 'hair cutting' sounds when it touches skin. If this feature actually did anything, it might not pull as much hair.<br /><br />COMFORT:<br /><br />Ugh. I literally just finished shaving with this razor and my face is killing me. I do not have sensitive skin, nor any skin conditions. The razor just pulls hair like crazy and it's extremely painful. I decided today that I could not tolerate it any longer and decided to return it and write this review. It's that bad.<br /><br />The comfort of actually holding the razor is amazing, though. I will miss holdingit. The weight is perfect, as is the balance, and the soft rubberized material used on the body is pleasant to the touch. The razor also has an ergonomic contour that is pleasing to hold. It just fits your hand.<br /><br />SHAVE TIME:<br /><br />Abysmal. Reason being is that you become so scared of the pain you're about to receive from the shave, you take 3 times longer than you normally would. It shouldn't take me 15 minutes to shave my face with an electric. I would expect 5-7 minutes tops. I actually had to break out my old 8985 to complete today's shave because the pain was so bad.<br /><br />PROS:<br /><br />++Shaves close<br />++VERY comfortable and pleasant to HOLD<br />++Holds a charge for a long time<br />++Charges quickly<br /><br />CONS:<br />--Feels like you're shaving with a medieval torture device<br />--Trimmer feature is worthless<br /><br />SUMMARY:<br /><br />I wanted to like this razor. I loved it when I held it in the store, but it's a razor, not a puppy. It needs to DO something other than be held and this Braun just doesn't perform. I ultimately ended up returning mine and haven't found a good enough replacement for my Braun 8985 yet.<br /><br />I had to give it 2 stars because it just doesn't do what it needs to be able to do: give a close, comfortable shave. The pain involved with shaving with this razor, in my opinion, is bad enough to warrant the loss of 2 stars (another star off for the trimmer feature, which is important).<br /><br />I guess if you shave literally every day and never use the trimmer, this razor might work out for you, but save that receipt. And don't expect to ever shave with it if you have more than 2 days growth.
  819. I bought this razor because my Norelco was irritating my skin. This one is also, although not as bad. I hope continued use will resolve the irritation.
  820. I bought this for my boyfriend. He uses it every day and it has paid for itself over and over again already. It's easy to use, easy to clean and does a great job without the pain or knicks.
  821. Solid does the job if you take care of it. Only issue I had was after I bought it on Amazon, I found several places where it sells for around $160.
  822. This shaver replaced a Braun 800 series shaver that was almost 15 years old. This is a great improvement over the old one even when it was new.

  824. Works great. Haven't used any other shavers to compare it to.
  825. It was more than what i expected. I get a clean and close shave every time. It self cleaning is awesome.
  826. old braun was better than the new one why spend that much cash for an inferior product I will not do it again
  827. I haven't used an electric razor in 20+ years and don't remember them being this good. Had my first electric razor been this good, I would never have gone blade. Auto-cleaning feature is good, but I find manually taking the head off and dumping the contents to also be of benefit (head pops right off with push of a button). Keeps a charge (never have I had an issue with this). Trimmers work like you would think they would, good enough to get the job done and don't pinch or bite like some do. I was concerned that the cleaning solution would be used up quickly, but I've been pleasantly surprised at how long it lasts. I would say I only use about a tank every 2 months when cleaning per the recommended interval set by the light on the charger. If I were to accidentally flush this down the toilet, I would buy this product again...
  828. I few things I have to say about this product. I have thick hair, so I was a skeptical about the reviews before purchasing. I thought it might have not given me a smooth shave. To my surprise, it did better then what I had expected. It's not entirely smooth but it's the closest to a smooth shave I have ever gotten with an electrical shaver. I use it every other day and gave up razors for good. If there is an ever a future updated version of the Braun Series, I am already sold!
  829. I have used Braun shavers for 25 years. All have been very good. This shaver however is terrible. The shaver requires multiple passes to remove beard unlike prior models. To get good shave I must resort to touch ups with a standard blade shaver. Save yourself some time and pick a different unit.
  830. (Update 4 July 2013)-on weekends I tend to not shave and have traditionally gone back to the razor blade Sunday night or Monday morning. This past week I opted to try this Braun instead and see how well it could do. Totally impressed. Shaved perfectly; no need to break out the razor at all. I was stunned, but very happy. Wish I could give this Braun another star!<br /><br />I've only ever had one other electric razor and it too was a Braun. However, it was a Braun purchased about 15-years ago.<br /><br />Ups: cleaning system works great; very quiet operation; provides a very good shave for me - comparable to a blade; uses same cleaning cartridges as my previous Braun; cleaning cartridges appear to last longer than on previous Braun razor<br /><br />Downs: cleaning cycle a bit noisier than expected; still misses some facial hair that likes to lie flat; power cord head too large - would be better at end nearer the base; no head cover for storage in a drawer<br /><br />I've not been overly impressed with the results from my old Braun every since I first purchased it. As such I've alternated between the electric razor and a blade each day. This new model does a far superior job. I'm getting a very close shave that is also very comfortable.<br /><br />I do, however, have issue with facial hair that likes to curl and loop and the razor misses a handful of these each morning. Still, it's such a marked improvement over my old one that I've given up the razor blade and been using only this electric one.<br /><br />Lastly, the cleaning cartridges used to dry out very quickly when left in the base of my older razor. These aren't cheap so I would take it out each day and replace the snap-on cover. This newer razor seems to keep the fluids less open and I'm not having the same issue with them drying out too quickly.
  831. Shaver works well, cleaning works well for about 6 months if you clean it all the time it works better. Only issue I have with that is the expense of the cleaner. I clean mine once a week and that works well, I then cap the cleaner so it won't dry out and that makes it last longer. Overall performance is good, although I love my circular blades this does a great job.
  832. I still use a safety razor when I want a really close shave, but this is the best electric that I have ever had in my 67 years.
  833. Great shaver! Much quieter than my older model. It doesn't shave as close as the older model, but it does work very well.
  834. I have used a Track 3 for many years. Every once in a while I try an electric but I always go back to the real razor. I recently had surgery and was told to quit using the razor because of the blood thinners that I was taking. Based on my son's recommendation I bought the Braun. He claimed that it would shave as close as the real thing. It does shave better than any other electric shaver that I have tried. It still does not shave as close as a blade. After using a blade, I can rub my face against the grain and not feel any whiskers. No matter how many times I go over my face with the Braun, I can still feel the stubble. If I wait a few days between shaves, it is necessary to use a blade as the Braun has a problem with a few days growth. I will still use the Braun for a quick touch up as it is a little quicker.
  835. The only thing we're not too thrilled about is having to buy expensive alcohol/lubricant mixes to keep the razor clean and sharp. The owner's manual says that you can do it with regular alcohol, but have to lubricate it weekly. If I could expect my spouse to remember to lubricate the razor, I'd probably go that route. Until then, I'll be purchasing alcohol packets monthly or so.

  854. I had to switch to an electric razor as I am on blood thinners. I did my research, and I purchased a Norelco 1180X. I had never tried a rotary razor and it got pretty good reviews. I was very disappointed in the Norelco. Even though this was a high end shaver (on sale for $170 bucks)the performance wasn't very good. It left my face very irritated, took forever to shave, and most importantly, just did not provide a close feeling shave at all. I used it for 3 weeks as suggested, but never got a satisfying shave out of it. So I sent it back and I await my refund. So I decided to try this Braun 760 CC. Well, I must say this was a real surprise compared to the Norelco. Very easy to use, very quick to shave, and what a close shave indeed! It isn't as close as a blade, how could it be? But it is much much closer than I got with the Norelco. Hands down an excellent shave. My wife couldn't believe the difference from the Norelco to the Braun. My face is baby smooth and no red irritation. I don't know how it will hold up over the long haul, but for quality of a shave I give it top marks!

  863. One of the best electric shavers I have owned. It gives me close shave without the burn and irritation. So far so good.
  864. Shaver performs well however cleaning mechanism totally superfluous and an expensive gimmick.
  865. I'm a first time Braun customer, and I can honestly say that I was terrified that this electric razor wouldn't live up to my expectations. Gladly, I was wrong. Being a mixed race person, I have had trouble shaving my whole life. From irritation to razor bumps to the razor not getting all of the hairs. This product makes a damn good improvement on all of those. It is extremely comfortable to shave with, it gently massages the face and I actually look forward to shaving with it.<br /><br />I have been using it for about a month now and the manufacturer didn't lie when they said it takes a few weeks for your face to get used to it. Those first few shaves were a little disappointing to me, but after a while I noticed shaves were getting easier and it was cutting more hair. I don't get any irritation WHATSOEVER and I hardly get any razor bumps at all, and the only reason I get them is because I allow my beard to grow out instead of shaving more often. I went from having a moderate amount of bumps to having 2 or 3 here and there (which are easy to remedy by using Bump Patrol and/or a tweezer). Even when you let your hair grow out, you get significantly less bumps than using a razor and letting it grow out. I HIGHLY recommend this and Bump Patrol to my curly haired brothers, it will ease your pain. There isn't any pulling, it's just a straight cut and the 3 different personalization modes are very convenient for certain parts of the face that require less or more power.<br /><br />That being said, this product does have a bit of a problem sometimes cutting flat lying hair; presumably for me because of the curliness. If I allow my hair to grow out a few days worth I have to use the trimmer to cut it low and then use the head to get it shorter. If I shaved everyday I probably wouldn't have this problem, but I'm lazy. It works well on the neck if you shave everyday or every 2 days (I shave every 2-3 days); again if you allow it to grow you will have to use the trimmer and that can be tricky on the neck. I have a small Peanut clipper and if the hair is too long on my neck I use that if the trimmer can't get it.<br /><br />I don't know why there are some people complaining about the noise. I had a small and cheap $25 Remington and it made 10x more noise. It was annoying in the morning and I worried about waking other people up. This is much quieter and so there isn't an issue. The cleaning unit also isn't exorbitantly loud and when I need a normal clean it usually runs for about 20 min. I clean it once a week and I still have a great deal of uses left in the cleaning fluid before I have to buy another pack.<br /><br />The cleaning fluid smells great and like many others have talked about on here is easy to conserve by removing it when you're not cleaning the shaver and capping it; doing this prevents it from evaporating.<br /><br />All in all I am very satisfied with this product, my only complaint would be that if you allow a few days worth of stubble to grow out it will take a while longer to shave, and subsequently require more passes. It is well worth the price I got it for ($162) and I have now become an enthusiastic Braun customer. I can only hope that their future products will be even better.
  866. I have found the shaving far better than expected. It is comfortable and fast. It is easy to clean out the shavings after use.   906. I read all the other reviews and I can confirm:<br /><br />1) This is the best shave I have ever had from an electric razor.<br />2) Those stubborn neck whiskers (right where a collared shirt rides) are gone.<br />3) The cleaning unit works as advertised (too early to judge the frequency of solution replacement).<br />4) It is too early to determine how long the blades last (18 months is quoted).<br />5) The feel of the razor and shaving motion is natural and comfortable.<br /><br />Upon registering the razor, Braun give an extra year of warranty.<br /><br />I am a cheap S.O.B., so I had a hard time paying so much for a razor.   907. I am one of those middle-aged guys who likes the convenience of an electric razor AND likes gadgets, so I sheepishly admit I've owned more of these things than is probably reasonable. It's a great unit that I've used every morning for almost a year now and it always does a good job.<br /><br />Some tips though: wash your face every night with a good men's facial cleanser like Nivea before you go to bed and shave every morning as soon as you get up. The clean skin with a little natural oil on it with only a day's growth is the best condition for shaving.<br /><br />If you have a heavy beard or don't shave every day, use a rotary razor. It's not as good a system but the Pulsonic doesn't handle long or dense beards well.<br /><br />Hope this helps!
