  910. good，its my second purchase on amazon.
  911. Outstanding shaver! This Braun shaver gives a very good, close shave compared to other Norelco or Panasonic shavers that I have owned. I have been shaving with electric razors for at least 15 years and during that time I have owned/used Panasonic (foil) and Norelco (rotary) razors, but this Braun Series 7 is by far the bast razor that I have owned. I do not have a heavy beard, but with the other razors I found that I still had to go over the area several times because I could still feel the stubble. With this razor, one time and my face feels like I shaved with a razor.<br />I would recommend this razor to a friend.
  912. Not good for curly hair.
  913. I replaced my series 5 with Braun Series 7-760cc model which works much better.
  914. The shaver works fine and is less pesky about cleaning but the mustache/beard trimmer is almost useless. I had a lower end Braun 5 series and it was so much better. But this one is designed in a way where it's very hard to see the trimmer over the top of the shaver to make sure you are trimming the right parts. I wish someone else would have said its a poor design when I bought this. If you only shave and trim sideburns you'll be fine but anything in front of your face is a pain in the butt.
  915. What a great shaver. For most of my shaving life I had been using Norelco shavers, but this one is much better and does a really nice job, plus it has a cleaning station which cleans and charges the unit.
  916. Great shaver at a great price! I love how it shaves and has auto clean. Too bad the cleaning solutions aren't cheaper to buy
  917. Exellent as designed.Recommend to anyone who requires the need to shave. That is all i have to say about that.
  918. The razor itself is the best I have ever owned. I have always had trouble with red marks after shaving on my neck and irritation. Not so with this razor. I can shave even after a few days of growth and never any sign of irritation. On top of that, it is a very smooth shave, better than I can get with a regular razor (which also irritate my skin). The wife was very impressed. 5 of 5 *****<br /><br />The base however has a flaw that is due to poor design. The contacts for charging the razor have a nasty habit of getting stuck just inside the plastic surface. Mine repeatedly fall in by simply inserting the razor. I believe this may be what is causing the other reviewers' issues with the cleaning cycle stopping and having to remove and reinsert the razor. Now, one of them has fallen in and I can't get it to pop back out. Trying to coax it out led to it being bent and still stuck. The contact is at the end of a thin stem that apparently bends very easily. I will report back on how easy it is to get fixed under warranty. Otherwise, I'll have to crack open the case. Sure I could charge it directly, but the bad prong also means it will not run the cleaning cycle.<br /><br />I am very disappointed in such a cheap solution to a fairly easy problem (how hard is it to put two solid prongs on top of a small spring, or secure them both at the top and bottom???). A $200 razor packaged with a $30 razor's base. 2 of 5 **<br /><br />Because of the base I give it an overall 3 of 5 ****
  919. This is my second Braun shaver. I wore out the first one. I still also use the top Gilette Safety Razor as well, but most say the SERIES 7-760cc gives me almost as close a shave.
  920. Two important points to keep in mind...<br /><br />1. You can't return this product to Amazon, even if it is defective... it is considered a product with hazardous material in it. So you are at the mercy of Braun USA.<br /><br />2. The 'Lock\\" mechanism, which switches the shaving head from a swivel to a fixed orientation, broke after 8 weeks.
  921. This shaver is nothing like the Braun 7526.<br /><br />This is a Procter & Gamble shaver with a German name. It is made of plastic (rather than metal), it has a flimsy hair trimmer which pops out at a very odd angle, and it comes with a small, ineffective cleaning brush. The carrying case can only hold the shaver and not the power cord (which makes travel cumbersome). There is no protection cap to cover the foil.<br /><br />The foil and cutter are now one unit which, at first, seems like a good idea. But if there's damage to either piece, the whole cassette must be replaced. On the old Braun shaver, the foil can be replaced without changing the cutter (or vice versa) if it was accidentally damaged. After 9+ years of using the 7526, this has happened. A new cassette also costs $12+ more than the same parts for the old shaver.
  922. My husband loves is shaver. He's been looking for months for the right shaver and he's found it. Thanks Braun and Thank you Amazon.
  923. This shaver is so much better than old 7000 series. Most notably the op out trimmer. I think it shaves close great!
  924. Does much better on my wrinkled face than my last rotery shaver. It gives me a great shave everytime and the cleaner works good.
  925. Best shaves yet. I think it is safe to say you can't go wrong with a Braun. The cleaning system may be overkill, but I subscribed to it. You might as well but a replacement foil and blade while you're shopping - I replace mine every 18 months.
  926. Good, but after 1 year become dull, heads needs replacement.
  927. I've used an electric shaver for over 65 years, and this is the best ever, bar none. The cleaning system is aces.
  928. This is a great shaver. Gets my husband's face way way smooth. The only thing he doesn't like about it is the fact that it doesn't work very well on his neck. He usually uses a manual razor to touch up his neck. That's why it doesn't get the 5 stars.
  929. I have had a Panny in the past. This is quieter and seems to do the job more efficiently. I love it, so far!
  930. I have used this shaver for the past 3 weeks now and I must say, it is really top notch. The charge holds for up to 5 days and I shave for about 6-7 minutes every morning.
  931. I tried this razor as soon as I got it and it does live up to what it promisses.<br /><br />Mike Bagley
  932. Recently had to purchase an electric shaver because of blood thinner medication. The Series 7-760 has solve my problem. I not only get a smooth shave and have no fear of cutting myself.
  933. This is my first electric razor. It is not as good as a razor and shaving cream but a lot easier and does an acceptable job.
